ReferenceBlocks.text: MATTHEW

block.text: MATTHEW

ReferenceBlocks.text: MATTHEW 1
The book of the genealogy of Jesus Christ, the son of David, the son of Abraham.

block.text: Dispela em i tok long ol lain tumbuna bilong Jisas Krais. Jisas em i bilong lain bilong Devit na Devit em i bilong lain bilong Abraham.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Abraham became the father of Isaac. Isaac became the father of Jacob. Jacob became the father of Judah and his brothers.

block.text: Abraham em i papa bilong Aisak. Na Aisak em i papa bilong Jekop. Na Jekop em i papa bilong Juda wantaim ol brata bilong en.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Judah became the father of Perez and Zerah by Tamar. Perez became the father of Hezron. Hezron became the father of Ram.

block.text: Juda em i papa bilong Peres wantaim Sera. Mama bilong tupela em Tamar. Na Peres em i papa bilong Hesron. Na Hesron em i papa bilong Ram.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Ram became the father of Amminadab. Amminadab became the father of Nahshon. Nahshon became the father of Salmon.

block.text: Na Ram em i papa bilong Aminadap. Na Aminadap em i papa bilong Nason. Na Nason em i papa bilong Salmon.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Salmon became the father of Boaz by Rahab. Boaz became the father of Obed by Ruth. Obed became the father of Jesse.

block.text: Na Salmon em i papa bilong Boas. Mama bilong en em Rahap. Na Boas em i papa bilong Obet. Mama bilong en em Rut. Na Obet em i papa bilong Jesi.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Jesse became the father of King David. David became the father of Solomon by her who had been the wife of Uriah.

block.text: Na Jesi em i papa bilong King Devit. Na Devit em i papa bilong Solomon. Mama bilong Solomon bipo em i bin i stap meri bilong Uria.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Solomon became the father of Rehoboam. Rehoboam became the father of Abijah. Abijah became the father of Asa.

block.text: Na Solomon em i papa bilong Rehoboam. Na Rehoboam em i papa bilong Abiya. Na Abiya em i papa bilong Asa.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Asa became the father of Jehoshaphat. Jehoshaphat became the father of Joram. Joram became the father of Uzziah.

block.text: Na Asa em i papa bilong Jehosafat. Na Jehosafat em i papa bilong Jehoram. Na Jehoram em i papa bilong Usia.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Uzziah became the father of Jotham. Jotham became the father of Ahaz. Ahaz became the father of Hezekiah.

block.text: Na Usia em i papa bilong Jotam. Na Jotam em i papa bilong Ahas. Na Ahas em i papa bilong Hesekia.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Hezekiah became the father of Manasseh. Manasseh became the father of Amon. Amon became the father of Josiah.

block.text: Na Hesekia em i papa bilong Manase. Na Manase em i papa bilong Emon. Na Emon em i papa bilong Josaia.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Josiah became the father of Jechoniah and his brothers, at the time of the exile to Babylon.

block.text: Na Josaia em i papa bilong Jehoiakin wantaim ol brata bilong en. Long dispela taim ol Israel i go kalabus long Babilon.

ReferenceBlocks.text: After the exile to Babylon, Jechoniah became the father of Shealtiel. Shealtiel became the father of Zerubbabel.

block.text: Stat long taim ol i go kalabus long Babilon, orait Jehoiakin em i papa bilong Sealtiel. Na Sealtiel em i papa bilong Serubabel.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Zerubbabel became the father of Abiud. Abiud became the father of Eliakim. Eliakim became the father of Azor.

block.text: Na Serubabel em i papa bilong Abiut. Na Abiut em i papa bilong Eliakim. Na Eliakim em i papa bilong Asor.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Azor became the father of Sadoc. Sadoc became the father of Achim. Achim became the father of Eliud.

block.text: Na Asor em i papa bilong Sadok. Na Sadok em i papa bilong Akim. Na Akim em i papa bilong Eliut.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Eliud became the father of Eleazar. Eleazar became the father of Matthan. Matthan became the father of Jacob.

block.text: Na Eliut em i papa bilong Eleasar. Na Eleasar em i papa bilong Matan. Na Matan em i papa bilong Jekop.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Jacob became the father of Joseph, the husband of Mary, from whom was born Jesus, who is called Christ.

block.text: Na Jekop em i papa bilong Josep. Na Josep em i man bilong Maria. bilong kisim bek ol manmeri bilong en.

ReferenceBlocks.text: So all the generations from Abraham to David are fourteen generations; from David to the exile to Babylon fourteen generations; and from the carrying away to Babylon to the Christ, fourteen generations.

block.text: Olsem na olgeta lain bilong Abraham, i kam inap long Devit, em i 14 lain. Na olgeta lain bilong Devit, i kam inap long taim ol i go kalabus long Babilon, em i 14 lain. Na stat long taim ol i go kalabus long Babilon, inap long taim Krais i kamap, dispela olgeta tu em i 14 lain.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Now the birth of Jesus Christ was like this; After his mother, Mary, was engaged to Joseph, before they came together, she was found pregnant by the Holy Spirit.

block.text: Stori bilong Jisas Krais i kamap, em i olsem. Mama bilong en, Maria, ol i makim em pinis bilong maritim Josep. Tasol taim tupela i no i stap wantaim yet, ol i lukim Maria i gat bel. Holi Spirit tasol i bin mekim na Maria i gat bel.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Joseph, her husband, being a righteous man, and not willing to make her a public example, intended to put her away secretly.

block.text: Man bilong en, Josep, em i stretpela man. Em i harim olsem Maria i gat bel, na em i laik lusim em. Tasol em i no laik givim sem long Maria long ai bilong ol manmeri. Olsem na em i laik lusim em isi tasol.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But when he thought about these things, behold, an angel of the Lord appeared to him in a dream, saying,

block.text: Josep i tingting yet long dispela, na zong driman wanpela ensel bilong Bikpela i kamap long em. Ensel i tok olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Joseph, son of David, don’t be afraid to take to yourself Mary, your wife, for that which is conceived in her is of the Holy Spirit.

block.text: "Josep, yu man bilong lain bilong Devit, yu no ken pret long kisim Maria olsem meri bilong yu. Harim. Dispela pikinini i stap long bel bilong en, em Holi Spirit i bin givim long em.

ReferenceBlocks.text: She shall bring forth a son. You shall call his name Jesus, for it is he who shall save his people from their sins.”

block.text: Bai em i karim pikinini man, na yu mas kolim nem bilong en Jisas, long wanem, em bai i tekewe sin bilong ol manmeri bilong en na kisim bek ol."

ReferenceBlocks.text: Now all this has happened, that it might be fulfilled which was spoken by the Lord through the prophet, saying,

block.text: Dispela olgeta samting i kamap bilong inapim wanpela tok Bikpela i bin mekim long maus bilong profet. Profet i bin tok olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Behold, the virgin shall be with child, and shall bring forth a son. They shall call his name Immanuel”;

block.text: "Harim. Wanpela meri i no bin slip wantaim man, em bai i gat bel na i karim wanpela pikinini man.

ReferenceBlocks.text: which is, being interpreted, “God with us.”
Joseph arose from his sleep, and did as the angel of the Lord commanded him, and took his wife to himself;

block.text: As bilong dispela nem i olsem, God i stap wantaim yumi.
Taim Josep i kirap long slip, orait em i mekim olsem ensel bilong Bikpela i bin tokim em. Em i kisim meri bilong en.

ReferenceBlocks.text: and didn’t know her sexually until she had brought forth her firstborn son. He named him Jesus.

block.text: Tasol em i no slip wantaim em, i go inap long taim Maria i karim pikinini man. Na em i kolim nem bilong en Jisas.

ReferenceBlocks.text: MATTHEW 2
Now when Jesus was born in Bethlehem of Judea in the days of King Herod, behold, wise men from the east came to Jerusalem,
saying,

block.text: Maria i karim Jisas long taun Betlehem long distrik Judia long taim Herot i stap king. Em i karim Jisas pinis, na bihain sampela saveman bilong hap sankamap i kam long Jerusalem na ol i askim nabaut olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Where is the one who is born King of the Jews? For we saw his star in the east, and have come to worship him.”

block.text: "Nupela pikinini em king bilong ol Juda, em i stap we? Mipela i lukim sta bilong en long hap sankamap, na mipela i kam bilong lotu long em."

ReferenceBlocks.text: When King Herod heard it, he was troubled, and all Jerusalem with him.

block.text: King Herot i harim dispela tok, na em i tingting planti. Na olgeta manmeri long Jerusalem ol tu i tingting planti.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Gathering together all the chief priests and scribes of the people, he asked them:

block.text: Orait Herot i singautim olgeta bikpris wantaim ol saveman bilong lo bilong Israel. Ol i kam bung na em i askim ol olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Where is the Christ to be be born?”

block.text: "Dispela man God i bin promis long salim i kam bilong kisim bek ol manmeri bilong en, em bai i kamap long wanem ples?"

ReferenceBlocks.text: They said to him,

block.text: Na ol i bekim tok olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “In Bethlehem of Judea, for this is written through the prophet,

block.text: "Em bai i kamap long taun Betlehem long Judia. Profet i bin raitim tok olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: ‘You Bethlehem, land of Judah, are in no way least among the princes of Judah: for out of you shall come forth a governor, who shall shepherd my people, Israel.’”

block.text: 'Yu Betlehem, long graun bilong Juda, yu no kam bihain tumas long ol taun i gat biknem long Juda. Nogat tru. Long wanem, wanpela man bilong yu bai i kamap hetman na em bai i stap wasman bilong lain bilong mi, Israel.'"

ReferenceBlocks.text: Then Herod secretly called the wise men, and asked them:

block.text: Herot i harim dispela tok na em i salim tok hait tasol i go long ol saveman bilong hap sankamap, long ol i mas kam lukim em. Ol i kam na em i askim ol gut,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “What time did the star appear?”

block.text: wanem taim dispela sta i bin kamap.

ReferenceBlocks.text: He sent them to Bethlehem, and said,

block.text: Na em i salim ol i go long Betlehem, na i tok,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Go and search diligently for the young child. When you have found him, bring me word, so that I also may come and worship him.”

block.text: "Yupela go na wok strong long painim dispela pikinini. Na taim yupela i lukim em pinis, orait yupela bringim tok i kam bek long mi, na bai mi tu mi go lotu long em."

ReferenceBlocks.text: They, having heard the king, went their way; and behold, the star, which they saw in the east, went before them, until it came and stood over where the young child was.

block.text: Ol i harim pinis tok bilong king, orait ol i go. Na ol i lukim gen dispela sta bipo ol i bin lukim long hap sankamap. Dispela sta i go paslain long ol na i go stap antap long haus pikinini i stap long en.

ReferenceBlocks.text: When they saw the star, they rejoiced with exceedingly great joy.

block.text: Taim ol i lukim sta, bel bilong ol i amamas moa moa yet.

ReferenceBlocks.text: They came into the house and saw the young child with Mary, his mother, and they fell down and worshiped him.

block.text: Ol saveman i go insait long haus, na ol i lukim pikinini wantaim mama bilong en Maria. Na ol i brukim skru na putim pes i go daun long graun na lotu long pikinini.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Opening their treasures, they offered to him gifts: gold, frankincense, and myrrh.

block.text: Na ol i opim paus bilong ol, na ol i givim ol presen long em. Ol i givim gol na gutpela sanda na paura bilong kamapim smok i gat gutpela smel.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Being warned in a dream that they shouldn’t return to Herod, they went back to their own country another way.

block.text: Na long driman God i tokim ol olsem, ol i no ken i go bek long Herot. Olsem na ol i bihainim narapela rot na ol i go bek long ples bilong ol.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Now when they had departed, behold, an angel of the Lord appeared to Joseph in a dream, saying,

block.text: Ol saveman i go pinis, na ensel bilong Bikpela i kamap long Josep long driman. Ensel i tok olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Arise and take the young child and his mother, and flee into Egypt, and stay there until I tell you, for Herod will seek the young child to destroy him.”

block.text: "Yu kirap na kisim pikinini wantaim mama bilong en, na yu ranawe i go long Isip. Na yu mas i stap long Isip inap long taim mi givim tok gen long yu, long wanem, Herot I laik painim pikinini na kilim em i dai."

ReferenceBlocks.text: He arose and took the young child and his mother by night, and departed into Egypt.

block.text: Orait Josep i kirap na i kisim pikinini wantaim mama bilong en long nait yet, na em i bringim ol i go long Isip.

ReferenceBlocks.text: They remained there until the death of Herod; that it might be fulfilled which was spoken by the Lord through the prophet, saying,

block.text: Na Josep i stap long Isip inap long Herot i dai pinis. Dispela samting i kamap bilong inapim wanpela tok Bikpela i bin mekim long maus bilong profet. Em i bin tok olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Out of Egypt I called my son.”

block.text: "Pikinini man bilong mi em i stap long Isip, na mi singautim em long lusim Isip na em i kam."

ReferenceBlocks.text: When Herod saw that he was mocked by the wise men, he became exceedingly angry. He sent out and killed all the male children who were in Bethlehem and in all the surrounding countryside, from two years old and under, according to the exact time which he had learned from the wise men.

block.text: Taim Herot i save olsem, ol saveman bilong hap sankamap i bin giamanim em, orait bel bilong en i hat moa. Na em i salim sampela man i go long taun Betlehem na long ol ples i stap klostu long taun, na ol i kilim i dai olgeta pikinini man i no winim tupela krismas yet. Herot i bin askim gut ol saveman wanem taim tru dispela sta i bin kamap, long wanem, em i gat tingting bilong kilim i dai ol pikinini ol mama i bin karim long dispela taim.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Then that which was spoken by Jeremiah the prophet was fulfilled, saying,

block.text: Ol dispela samting inapim wanpela tok God i bin mekim pinis long maus bilong profet Jeremaia. Em i tok olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “A voice was heard in Ramah, lamentation, weeping and great mourning, Rachel weeping for her children; she wouldn’t be comforted, because they are no more.”

block.text: "Bikpela krai na singsing sori i kamap long taun Rama. Em Resel i krai sori long ol pikinini bilong en i dai pinis. Na em i no laik bai ol manmeri i mekim gut bel bilong en, long wanem, olgeta pikinini bilong en i no moa i stap."

ReferenceBlocks.text: But when Herod was dead, behold, an angel of the Lord appeared in a dream to Joseph in Egypt, saying,

block.text: Taim Herot i dai pinis, orait long Isip ensel bilong Bikpela i kamap long Josep long driman.
Na ensel i tokim Josep olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Arise and take the young child and his mother, and go into the land of Israel, for those who sought the young child’s life are dead.”

block.text: "Yu kirap na kisim pikinini wantaim mama bilong en, na yu go bek long Israel. Ol man i laik kilim pikinini, ol i dai pinis."

ReferenceBlocks.text: He arose and took the young child and his mother, and came into the land of Israel.

block.text: Orait Josep i kirap, na i kisim pikinini wantaim mama bilong en, na ol i go bek long kantri Israel.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But when he heard that Archelaus was reigning over Judea in the place of his father, Herod, he was afraid to go there. Being warned in a dream, he withdrew into the region of Galilee.

block.text: Tasol Josep i harim tok olsem Arkelaus i kisim ples bilong papa bilong en Herot, na i stap king bilong Judia. Olsem na Josep i pret long i go long dispela hap. Tasol God i givim tok long Josep long driman, na Josep i go long hap bilong distrik Galili.

ReferenceBlocks.text: He came and lived in a city called Nazareth; that it might be fulfilled which was spoken through the prophets:

block.text: Em i go sindaun long wanpela taun ol i kolim Nasaret, na long dispela pasin em inapim dispela tok bilong ol profet,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “He will be called a Nazarene.”

block.text: "Bai ol i kolim em man bilong Nasaret."

ReferenceBlocks.text: MATTHEW 3
In those days, John the Baptizer came, preaching in the wilderness of Judea, saying,

block.text: Long dispela taim Jon, man bilong givim baptais, em i kamap. Em i stap long ples i no gat man long distrik Judia, na em i autim tok long ol manmeri.
Em i tok olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Repent, for the Kingdom of Heaven is at hand!”

block.text: "Yupela tanim bel. Kingdom bilong heven em i kam klostu pinis."

ReferenceBlocks.text: For this is he who was spoken of by Isaiah the prophet, saying,

block.text: Jon em i dispela man God i bin tok long en long maus bilong profet Aisaia. Em i tok olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “The voice of one crying in the wilderness, make ready the way of the Lord. Make his paths straight.”

block.text: "Long ples i no gat man, maus bilong wanpela man i singaut olsem, 'Redim rot bilong Bikpela. Stretim ol rot bilong en.' "

ReferenceBlocks.text: Now John himself wore clothing made of camel’s hair, with a leather belt around his waist. His food was locusts and wild honey.

block.text: Jon i save putim klos ol i wokim long gras bilong kamel, na em i save pasim let long bel bilong en. Na em i save kaikai ol grasopa wantaim hani bilong bus.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Then people from Jerusalem, all of Judea, and all the region around the Jordan went out to him.

block.text: Long dispela taim ol Jerusalem na olgeta Judia na olgeta man bilong ol ples i stap klostu long wara Jordan, ol i kam long Jon.

ReferenceBlocks.text: They were baptized by him in the Jordan, confessing their sins.

block.text: Na ol i autim sin bilong ol, na Jon i baptaisim ol long wara Jordan.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But when he saw many of the Pharisees and Sadducees coming for his baptism, he said to them,

block.text: Jon i lukim planti Farisi na Sadyusi i kam bilong kisim baptais, na em i tokim ol olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “You offspring of vipers, who warned you to flee from the wrath to come?

block.text: "Yupela pikinini bilong snek nogut, God i belhat long yupela na em bai i mekim save long yupela. Husat i tokim yupela na yupela i laik ranawe na abrusim dispela taim nogut i laik kamap long yupela?

ReferenceBlocks.text: Therefore bring forth fruit worthy of repentance!

block.text: Sapos yupela i tanim bel tru, orait pasin bilong yupela i mas soim olsem yupela i tanim bel pinis.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Don’t think to yourselves, ‘We have Abraham for our father,’ for I tell you that God is able to raise up children to Abraham from these stones.

block.text: Yupela i no ken tingting olsem long bel bilong yupela, 'Abraham em i tumbuna papa bilong mipela.' Mi tokim yupela, God inap mekim ol dispela ston hia i kamap ol lain tumbuna pikinini bilong Abraham.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Even now the axe lies at the root of the trees. Therefore every tree that doesn’t bring forth good fruit is cut down, and cast into the fire.

block.text: Tamiok i stap pinis long as bilong diwai, na olgeta diwai i no save karim gutpela kaikai, em bai ol i katim na tromoi i go long paia.

ReferenceBlocks.text: I indeed baptize you in water for repentance, but there is one who comes after me is mightier than I, whose shoes I am not worthy to carry. He will baptize you in the Holy Spirit.

block.text: "Mi save baptaisim yupela long wara olsem mak bilong yupela i tanim bel pinis. Tasol man i kam bihain long mi, strong bilong en i winim strong bilong mi. Mi no gutpela man inap long karim su bilong em. Em bai i baptaisim yupela long Holi Spirit na long paia.

ReferenceBlocks.text: His winnowing fork is in his hand, and he will thoroughly cleanse his threshing floor. He will gather his wheat into the barn, but the chaff he will burn up with unquenchable fire.”

block.text: Em i kam olsem man i holim savol long han bilong en, bilong rausim olgeta pipia i stap long wit. Na em bai i bungim wit long haus wit bilong en. Tasol pipia em bai i kukim long paia i no save dai."

ReferenceBlocks.text: Then Jesus came from Galilee to the Jordan to John, to be baptized by him.

block.text: Long dispela taim Jisas i lusim Galili na i go long wara Jordan. Em i go long Jon, na i laik kisim baptais long han bilong Jon.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But John would have hindered him, saying,

block.text: Tasol Jon i laik pasim em, na i tok,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “I need to be baptized by you, and you come to me?”

block.text: "Mobeta mi kisim baptais long yu. Olsem wanem na yu kam long mi?"

ReferenceBlocks.text: But Jesus, answering, said to him,

block.text: Tasol Jisas i bekim tok bilong em olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Allow it now, for this is the fitting way for us to fulfill all righteousness.”

block.text: "Maski, nau yu mas mekim olsem mi tok. Long dispela pasin bai yumi inapim olgeta samting God i laik bai yumi mas mekim."

ReferenceBlocks.text: Then he allowed him.

block.text: Olsem na Jon i bihainim tok bilong em.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Jesus, when he was baptized, went up directly from the water: and behold, the heavens were opened to him. He saw the Spirit of God descending as a dove, and coming on him.

block.text: Jisas i kisim baptais pinis, na kwiktaim em i lusim wara na i kam antap. Na heven i op, na em i lukim Spirit bilong God i kam daun olsem wanpela bilong ol dispela kain pisin ol i kolim balus, na i kam i stap long em.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Behold, a voice out of the heavens said,

block.text: Na long heven wanpela maus i singaut olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “This is my beloved Son, with whom I am well pleased.”

block.text: "Dispela em i Pikinini bilong mi. Mi laikim em tumas. Bel bilong mi em i amamas long em."

ReferenceBlocks.text: MATTHEW 4
Then Jesus was led up by the Spirit into the wilderness to be tempted by the devil.

block.text: Long dispela taim Holi Spirit i bringim Jisas i go long ples i no gat man, bai Satan i traim em.

ReferenceBlocks.text: When he had fasted forty days and forty nights, he was hungry afterward.

block.text: Na Jisas i no kisim kaikai inap 40 san na 40 nait. Na bihain em i hangre.

ReferenceBlocks.text: The tempter came and said to him,

block.text: Na man bilong traim i kam kamap long em, na i tokim em olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “If you are the Son of God, command that these stones become bread.”

block.text: "Sapos i tru yu Pikinini Bilong God, orait yu tok na ol dispela ston i ken tanim na i kamap bret."

ReferenceBlocks.text: But he answered,

block.text: Tasol Jisas i bekim tok olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “It is written, ‘Man shall not live by bread alone, but by every word that proceeds out of the mouth of God.’”

block.text: "Buk bilong God i gat tok olsem, 'Ol manmeri i no inap kisim laip long kaikai tasol. Nogat. Ol i mas bihainim olgeta tok bilong God tu na bai ol i kisim laip.' "

ReferenceBlocks.text: Then the devil took him into the holy city. He set him on the pinnacle of the temple,
and said to him,

block.text: Em i tok olsem, na Satan i kisim em i go long Jerusalem, taun bilong God, na i putim em antap tru long tempel.
Na Satan i tokim em olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “If you are the Son of God, throw yourself down, for it is written, ‘He will put his angels in charge of you.’ and, ‘On their hands they will bear you up, so that you don’t dash your foot against a stone.’”

block.text: "Sapos i tru yu Pikinini Bilong God, orait yu kalap i go daun. Long wanem, buk bilong God i gat tok olsem, 'Em bai i tokim ol ensel bilong en long ol i mas was long yu.' Na 'Ol bai i karim yu long han bilong ol, nogut wanpela ston i sutim lek bilong yu.' "

ReferenceBlocks.text: Jesus said to him,

block.text: Tasol Jisas I tokim em,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Again, it is written, ‘You shall not test the Lord, your God.’”

block.text: "Buk bilong God i tok moa olsem, 'Yu no ken traim strong bilong God, Bikpela bilong yu.'"

ReferenceBlocks.text: Again, the devil took him to an exceedingly high mountain, and showed him all the kingdoms of the world, and their glory.
He said to him,

block.text: Satan i kisim Jisas gen na i go long wanpela maunten i antap moa. Na Satan i soim em olgeta strongpela kantri bilong dispela graun wantaim ol gutpela samting bilong ol.
Na em i tokim Jisas olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “I will give you all of these things, if you will fall down and worship me.”

block.text: "Sapos yu brukim skru na lotu long mi, orait bai mi givim yu dispela olgeta samting."

ReferenceBlocks.text: Then Jesus said to him,

block.text: Na Jisas i tokim em,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Get behind me, Satan! For it is written, ‘You shall worship the Lord your God, and you shall serve him only.’”

block.text: "Satan, yu klia. Buk bilong God i tok, 'Yu mas aninit long God, Bikpela bilong yu. Na yu mas lotu long em wanpela tasol.' "

ReferenceBlocks.text: Then the devil left him, and behold, angels came and served him.

block.text: Olsem na Satan i lusim em. Na ol ensel i kam na i helpim Jisas.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Now when Jesus heard that John was delivered up, he withdrew into Galilee.

block.text: Taim Jisas i harim tok olsem, ol i putim Jon pinis long kalabus, orait em i go long distrik Galili.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Leaving Nazareth, he came and lived in Capernaum, which is by the sea, in the region of Zebulun and Naphtali.

block.text: Na em i lusim taun Nasaret na i go sindaun long taun Kaperneam. Kaperneam em i stap arere long raunwara Galili, long graun bilong ol lain Sebulun na Naptali.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Therefore what was spoken by Isaiah the prophet was fulfilled:

block.text: Long dispela pasin Jisas inapim wanpela tok God i bin mekim long maus bilong profet Aisaia olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “The land of Zebulun and the land of Naphtali, toward the sea, beyond the Jordan, Galilee of the Gentiles,

block.text: "Ol manmeri bilong graun bilong Sebulun na graun bilong Naptali, em graun i stap klostu long bikrot i go long solwara na graun i stap long hapsait bilong wara Jordan, em graun bilong distrik Galili, dispela distrik i gat planti manmeri bilong ol arapela kantri tu i stap long en,

ReferenceBlocks.text: the people who sat in darkness saw a great light, to those who sat in the region and shadow of death, to them light has dawned.”

block.text: ol dispela manmeri i bin sindaun long bikpela tudak, ol i lukim pinis bikpela lait. Ol manmeri i bin stap long ples tudak, lait i kamap pinis long ol."

ReferenceBlocks.text: From that time, Jesus began to preach, and to say,

block.text: Long dispela taim Jisas i stat long autim tok long ol manmeri. Em i tok olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Repent! For the Kingdom of Heaven is at hand.”

block.text: "Yupela i mas tanim bel, long wanem, kingdom bilong heven em i kam klostu pinis."

ReferenceBlocks.text: Walking by the sea of Galilee, he saw two brothers: Simon, who is called Peter, and Andrew, his brother, casting a net into the sea; for they were fishermen.
He said to them,

block.text: Jisas i wokabaut arere long raunwara Galili, na em i lukim tupela brata, em Saimon, ol i kolim Pita, na brata bilong en Andru. Tupela i wok long tromoi umben long raunwara. Tupela i save wok bisnis long kisim pis.
Orait Jisas i tokim tupela olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Come after me, and I will make you fishers for men.”

block.text: "Yutupela kam bihainim mi, na bai mi lainim yutupela long pasin bilong kisim ol manmeri."

ReferenceBlocks.text: They immediately left their nets and followed him.

block.text: Na kwiktaim tupela i lusim umben na i go bihainim em.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Going on from there, he saw two other brothers, James the son of Zebedee, and John his brother, in the boat with Zebedee their father, mending their nets. He called them.

block.text: Jisas i wokabaut i go moa, na em i lukim arapela tupela brata, em Jems, pikinini bilong Sebedi, wantaim brata bilong en Jon. Tupela i stap long bot wantaim papa bilong tupela, Sebedi. Ol umben bilong ol i bruk, na ol i wok long stretim. Orait Jisas i singautim tupela.

ReferenceBlocks.text: They immediately left the boat and their father, and followed him.

block.text: Na kwiktaim tupela i lusim bot na i lusim papa bilong tupela, na tupela i go bihainim Jisas.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Jesus went about in all Galilee, teaching in their synagogues, preaching the Good News of the Kingdom, and healing every disease and every sickness among the people.

block.text: Jisas i go raun long olgeta hap bilong distrik Galili. Em i save go insait long ol haus lotu bilong ol na skulim ol manmeri. Em i autim gutnius bilong kingdom bilong God, na em i mekim orait olgeta sik na olgeta samting i bagarapim bodi bilong ol manmeri.

ReferenceBlocks.text: The report about him went out into all Syria. They brought to him all who were sick, afflicted with various diseases and torments, possessed with demons, epileptics, and paralytics; and he healed them.

block.text: Ol i stori long em long olgeta hap bilong provins Siria. Olsem na ol manmeri i bringim olgeta man ol kain kain sik i bagarapim ol na ol i karim pen nogut, na ol man i gat spirit nogut, na ol man i gat dispela kain sik i save mekim ol i pundaun na guria nogut, na ol man bun bilong ol i dai olgeta. Na Jisas i mekim ol i kamap orait.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Great multitudes from Galilee, Decapolis, Jerusalem, Judea and from beyond the Jordan followed him.

block.text: Na planti bikpela lain manmeri bilong Galili na bilong hap bilong distrik Dekapolis, na bilong Jerusalem na Judia na bilong graun i stap long hapsait bilong wara Jordan, ol i save bihainim em i go.

ReferenceBlocks.text: MATTHEW 5
Seeing the multitudes, he went up onto the mountain. When he had sat down, his disciples came to him.
He began to teach them, saying,

block.text: Jisas i lukim ol bikpela lain manmeri i kam, na em i go antap long maunten. Em i sindaun, na ol disaipel bilong en i kam long em.
Na Jisas i skulim ol disaipel olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Blessed are the poor in spirit, for theirs is the Kingdom of Heaven.

block.text: "Ol manmeri i save, ol i stap rabis tru long ol samting bilong God, em ol i ken amamas. Ol dispela manmeri bai i kisim ol gutpela samting bilong kingdom bilong heven.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Blessed are those who mourn, for they shall be comforted.

block.text: "Ol manmeri i krai i stap, em ol i ken amamas. God bai i mekim gut bel bilong ol.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Blessed are the gentle, for they shall inherit the earth.

block.text: "Ol manmeri i save daunim nem bilong ol yet, em ol i ken amamas. Bai God i givim olgeta graun long ol.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Blessed are those who hunger and thirst after righteousness, for they shall be filled.

block.text: "Ol manmeri i laikim tumas long bihainim stretpela pasin, long wankain pasin olsem man i hangre tru na i laikim tumas long kisim kaikai na i dai long wara, em ol i ken amamas. Bai God inapim ol tru.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Blessed are the merciful, for they shall obtain mercy.

block.text: "Ol manmeri i save marimari long ol arapela, em ol i ken amamas. Bai God i marimari long ol.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Blessed are the pure in heart, for they shall see God.

block.text: "Ol manmeri bel bilong ol i klin, em ol i ken amamas. Bai ol i lukim God.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Blessed are the peacemakers, for they shall be called children of God.

block.text: "Ol manmeri i save mekim dai ol kros na pait, em ol i ken amamas. Bai ol i kolim ol pikinini bilong God.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Blessed are those who have been persecuted for righteousness’ sake, for theirs is the Kingdom of Heaven.

block.text: "Ol manmeri i save bihainim stretpela pasin na long dispela as ol i kisim hevi long ol arapela, em ol i ken amamas. Kingdom bilong heven em i bilong ol.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Blessed are you when people reproach you, persecute you, and say all kinds of evil against you falsely, for my sake.

block.text: "Sapos ol i lukim yupela i stap long lain bilong mi, na ol i tok nogut long yupela na ol i mekim nogut long yupela na sutim kain kain tok giaman long yupela, orait yupela i ken amamas.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Rejoice, and be exceedingly glad, for great is your reward in heaven. For that is how they persecuted the prophets who were before you.

block.text: Yupela i ken belgut na amamas tru, long wanem, bikpela pe i wetim yupela long heven. Ol man i bin mekim ol wankain pasin nogut long ol profet i bin i go paslain long yupela."

ReferenceBlocks.text: You are the salt of the earth, but if the salt has lost its flavor, with what will it be salted? It is then good for nothing, but to be cast out and trodden under the feet of men.

block.text: Jisas i tok moa olsem, "Yupela i olsem sol bilong graun. Tasol sapos sol i lusim pait bilong en, orait bai yumi mekim wanem na dispela sol i kamap gutpela gen? Kain sol olsem em i no gat wok moa. Ol man i save rausim tasol na krungutim long lek bilong ol.

ReferenceBlocks.text: You are the light of the world. A city located on a hill can’t be hidden.

block.text: "Yupela i olsem lait bilong graun. Tingim. Wanpela taun i stap antap long maunten, em i no inap hait.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Neither do you light a lamp, and put it under a measuring basket, but on a stand; and it shines to all who are in the house.

block.text: Na tu, ol man i no save laitim lam na putim aninit long wanpela baket. Nogat. Ol i save putim antap long tebol, na em i givim lait long olgeta man i stap long haus.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Even so, let your light shine before men; that they may see your good works, and glorify your Father who is in heaven.

block.text: Olsem tasol, lait bilong yupela i mas lait long ai bilong ol manmeri, bai ol i lukim ol gutpela pasin yupela i mekim, na bai ol i litimapim nem bilong Papa bilong yupela i stap long heven."

ReferenceBlocks.text: Don’t think that I came to destroy the law or the prophets. I didn’t come to destroy, but to fulfill.

block.text: Jisas i tok moa olsem, "Yupela i no ken ting mi kam bilong rausim tok bilong lo na tok bilong ol profet. Nogat. Mi no kam bilong rausim, mi kam bilong inapim tru.

ReferenceBlocks.text: For most certainly, I tell you, until heaven and earth pass away, not even one smallest letter or one tiny pen stroke shall in any way pass away from the law, until all things are accomplished.

block.text: Mi tok tru long yupela, inap long taim skai na graun i pinis, i no gat wanpela liklik hap tok bilong lo bai i lus. Nogat. Ol liklik hap rait, na ol liklik mak ol i raitim long lo, olgeta bai i stap. Lo bai i stap olsem tasol inap long olgeta samting i kamap pinis.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Whoever, therefore, shall break one of these least commandments, and teach others to do so, shall be called least in the Kingdom of Heaven; but whoever shall do and teach them shall be called great in the Kingdom of Heaven.

block.text: Olsem na sapos wanpela man i lukim wanpela hap bilong lo i olsem samting nating, na em i pulim ol arapela man tu long mekim olsem, orait maski dispela hap bilong lo i liklik tru, bai nem bilong dispela man i stap liklik tru long kingdom bilong heven. Tasol man i bihainim lo na i skulim ol manmeri long bihainim, em bai i gat biknem long kingdom bilong heven.

ReferenceBlocks.text: For I tell you that unless your righteousness exceeds that of the scribes and Pharisees, there is no way you will enter into the Kingdom of Heaven.

block.text: Mi tokim yupela, sapos yupela i no bihainim tru laik bilong God, na stretpela pasin bilong yupela i no winim tru stretpela pasin bilong ol saveman bilong lo wantaim ol Farisi, bai yupela i no inap i go insait long kingdom bilong heven."

ReferenceBlocks.text: You have heard that it was said to the ancient ones, ‘You shall not murder;’ and ‘Whoever shall murder shall be in danger of the judgment.’

block.text: Jisas i tok moa olsem, "Yupela i harim pinis dispela tok ol tumbuna i bin kisim, 'Yupela i no ken kilim i dai ol arapela manmeri. Na sapos wanpela man i kilim man i dai, em i mas kamap long kot.'

ReferenceBlocks.text: But I tell you, that everyone who is angry with his brother without a cause shall be in danger of the judgment; and whoever shall say to his brother, ‘Raca!’ shall be in danger of the council; and whoever shall say, ‘You fool!’ shall be in danger of the fire of Gehenna.

block.text: Tasol mi tokim yupela olsem, man i kros nogut long brata bilong en, em i mas kamap long kot. Na man i tok nogut long brata bilong en, em i mas kamap long namba wan kaunsil. Na man i tokim narapela man olsem, 'Yu longlong man tru,' em i mas i go long paia bilong hel.

ReferenceBlocks.text: If therefore you are offering your gift at the altar, and there remember that your brother has anything against you,
leave your gift there before the altar, and go your way. First be reconciled to your brother, and then come and offer your gift.

block.text: "Olsem na sapos yu bringim ofa bilong yu i kam long alta, na yu tingim brata bilong yu em i gat tok long yu,
orait yu mas lusim ofa bilong yu i stap klostu long alta. Na yu go pastaim na stretim tok wantaim brata bilong yu. Stretim pinis, orait nau yu ken i go na givim ofa bilong yu long God.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Agree with your adversary quickly, while you are with him in the way; lest perhaps the prosecutor deliver you to the judge, and the judge deliver you to the officer, and you be cast into prison.

block.text: "Sapos wanpela man i laik kotim yu, na yutupela i wokabaut yet long rot i go long ples bilong kot, orait yu mas hariap na stretim tok wantaim em. Nogut dispela man i putim yu long han bilong jas, na jas i putim yu long han bilong plisman, na plisman i putim yu long haus kalabus.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Most certainly I tell you, you shall by no means get out of there, until you have paid the last penny.

block.text: Mi tok tru long yu, yu bai i stap long haus kalabus inap long yu baim olgeta mani ol i makim bilong yu."

ReferenceBlocks.text: You have heard that it was said, ‘You shall not commit adultery;’

block.text: Jisas i tok moa olsem, "Yupela i harim pinis bipo ol i tok olsem, 'Yupela ol marit, yupela i no ken mekim pasin pamuk.'

ReferenceBlocks.text: but I tell you that everyone who gazes at a woman to lust after her has committed adultery with her already in his heart.

block.text: Tasol mi tokim yupela olsem, sapos wanpela man i lukim wanpela meri na i gat mangal nogut long em, dispela man i mekim pasin pamuk pinis long bel bilong em.

ReferenceBlocks.text: If your right eye causes you to stumble, pluck it out and throw it away from you. For it is more profitable for you that one of your members should perish, than for your whole body to be cast into Gehenna.

block.text: "Sapos ai long han sut bilong yu i pulim yu long mekim sin, orait yu mas kamautim na tromoi. Mobeta wanpela hap bodi bilong yu i lus na yu no mekim sin, na bai ol i no tromoi bodi bilong yu olgeta i go long hel.

ReferenceBlocks.text: If your right hand causes you to stumble, cut it off, and throw it away from you. For it is more profitable for you that one of your members should perish, than for your whole body to be cast into Gehenna.

block.text: Na sapos han sut bilong yu i mekim yu i pundaun long sin, orait yu mas katim na tromoi. Mobeta wanpela hap bodi bilong yu i lus, na yu no mekim sin, na bodi bilong yu olgeta i no i go long hel."

ReferenceBlocks.text: It was also said, ‘Whoever shall put away his wife, let him give her a writing of divorce.’

block.text: Jisas i tok moa olsem, "Bipo ol i save tok olsem, 'Sapos wanpela man i rausim meri bilong en, orait em i mas givim em wanpela pepa bilong katim marit.'

ReferenceBlocks.text: But I tell you that whoever puts away his wife, except for the cause of sexual immorality, makes her an adulteress; and whoever marries her when she is put away commits adultery.

block.text: Tasol mi tokim yupela, sapos man i rausim meri bilong en taim meri i no bin mekim pasin pamuk, orait dispela man i mekim meri i kalapim lo bilong marit. Long wanem, taim dispela meri i maritim narapela man, meri i mekim pasin pamuk. Na man i maritim wanpela meri, bipo man bilong en i bin rausim em, em tu i kalapim lo bilong marit na i mekim pasin pamuk."

ReferenceBlocks.text: Again you have heard that it was said to them of old time, ‘You shall not make false vows, but shall perform to the Lord your vows,’

block.text: Jisas i tok moa olsem, "Narapela tok ol tumbuna i kisim na yupela i harim pinis, em i olsem, 'Yu no ken giaman taim yu tok tru antap. Na sapos yu tok tru antap long mekim wanpela samting, orait yu mas bihainim dispela tok na mekim stret long ai bilong Bikpela.'

ReferenceBlocks.text: but I tell you, don’t swear at all: neither by heaven, for it is the throne of God;

block.text: Tasol mi tokim yupela, yupela i no ken mekim tok tru antap. Nogat tru. Yupela i no ken kolim heven bilong strongim wanpela tok, long wanem, heven em i sia king bilong God.

ReferenceBlocks.text: nor by the earth, for it is the footstool of his feet; nor by Jerusalem, for it is the city of the great King.

block.text: Na yupela i no ken kolim graun bilong strongim wanpela tok, long wanem, graun em i ples God i save putim lek bilong en antap long en. Na yupela i no ken kolim Jerusalem bilong strongim wanpela tok, long wanem, Jerusalem em i taun bilong Nambawan King.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Neither shall you swear by your head, for you can’t make one hair white or black.

block.text: Na yu no ken kolim het bilong yu bilong strongim wanpela tok, long wanem, yu no inap long mekim wanpela gras bilong het bilong yu i kamap waitpela o blakpela.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But let your ‘Yes’ be ‘Yes’ and your ‘No’ be ‘No.’ Whatever is more than these is of the evil one.

block.text: Yupela i mas tok 'Yes' na 'Nogat' tasol. Em inap. Tok ol i save skruim long dispela, em ol tok Satan yet i kamapim."

ReferenceBlocks.text: You have heard that it was said, ‘An eye for an eye, and a tooth for a tooth.’

block.text: Jisas i tok moa olsem, "Yupela i harim pinis bipo ol i bin tok olsem, 'Sapos wanpela man i bagarapim ai bilong narapela man, orait yupela i mas bagarapim ai bilong en. Na sapos wanpela man i brukim tit bilong narapela man, orait yupela i mas brukim tit bilong en.'

ReferenceBlocks.text: But I tell you, don’t resist him who is evil; but whoever strikes you on your right cheek, turn to him the other also.

block.text: Tasol mi tokim yupela olsem, yupela i no ken bekim rong long man i mekim nogut long yupela. Nogat. Sapos wanpela man i solapim wanpela wasket bilong yu, orait yu mas tanim narapela wasket tu i go long em.

ReferenceBlocks.text: If anyone sues you to take away your coat, let him have your cloak also.

block.text: Na sapos wanpela man i laik kotim yu na kisim siot bilong yu, orait yu mas givim longpela klos bilong yu tu long em.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Whoever compels you to go one mile, go with him two.

block.text: Na sapos wanpela man i strong long yu mas karim kago bilong en i go inap wan kilomita, orait yu mas karim kago i go inap 2 kilomita.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Give to him who asks you, and don’t turn away him who desires to borrow from you.

block.text: Sapos wanpela man i askim yu long givim wanpela samting long em, orait yu mas givim. Na sapos man i laik dinau long yu, orait yu no ken givim baksait long em."

ReferenceBlocks.text: You have heard that it was said, ‘You shall love your neighbor, and hate your enemy.’

block.text: Jisas i tok moa olsem, "Yupela i harim pinis bipo ol i bin tok olsem, 'Yu mas laikim tru ol wantok, na yu mas bel nogut long ol birua bilong yu.'

ReferenceBlocks.text: But I tell you, love your enemies, bless those who curse you, do good to those who hate you, and pray for those who mistreat you and persecute you.

block.text: Tasol mi tokim yupela olsem, yupela i mas laikim ol birua bilong yupela, na yupela i mas beten bai God i marimari long ol man i save mekim pasin nogut long yupela.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Then you will be children of your Father who is in heaven. For He makes his sun to rise on the evil and the good, and He sends rain on the just and the unjust.

block.text: Olsem bai yupela i stap pikinini bilong Papa bilong yupela em i stap long heven. Em i save mekim san bilong en i kamap antap long ol man nogut na long ol gutpela man wantaim. Na em i save mekim ren i kam daun long ol stretpela man na long ol man bilong mekim pasin i no stret tu.

ReferenceBlocks.text: For if you love those who love you, what reward do you have? Don’t even the tax collectors do the same?

block.text: Sapos yupela i laikim tasol ol man i save laikim yupela, bai yupela i kisim wanem pe? Ol man bilong kisim takis, ol tu i save mekim wankain pasin.

ReferenceBlocks.text: If you only greet your friends, what more do you do than others? Don’t even the tax collectors do the same?

block.text: Na sapos yupela i givim gude long ol brata bilong yupela tasol, bai yupela i winim ol arapela man long wanem samting? Ol haiden tu i save mekim olsem.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Therefore you shall be perfect, just as your Father in heaven is perfect.”

block.text: Yupela i mas i stap stretpela manmeri tru, olsem Papa bilong yupela i stap long heven em i stap stretpela tru."

ReferenceBlocks.text: MATTHEW 6
“Be careful that you don’t do your charitable giving before men, to be seen by them. Otherwise you will have no reward from your Father who is in heaven.

block.text: Jisas i tok moa olsem, "Yupela lukaut. Yupela i no ken mekim ol gutpela gutpela pasin bilong yupela long ai bilong ol manmeri, bai ol i lukim. Sapos yupela i mekim olsem, yupela bai i no inap kisim pe long Papa bilong yupela i stap long heven.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Therefore when you do merciful deeds, don’t sound a trumpet before yourself, as the hypocrites do in the synagogues and in the streets, that they may get glory from men. Most certainly I tell you, they have received their reward.

block.text: "Sapos yu laik givim samting long ol rabisman, yu no ken salim man i winim biugel i go paslain long yu olsem ol sampela man i save mekim insait long ol haus lotu na long ol rot. Ol dispela man i laik giamanim ol manmeri, bai ol manmeri i ting ol i gutpela man na givim biknem long ol. Mi tok tru long yupela, ol dispela man i kisim pinis pe bilong ol.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But when you do merciful deeds, don’t let your left hand know what your right hand does.

block.text: Sapos yu laik helpim ol rabisman, orait han kais bilong yu i no ken save long samting han sut i mekim.

ReferenceBlocks.text: That way your merciful deeds will be done in secret, then your Father who sees in secret will reward you openly.

block.text: Olsem na dispela wok marimari yu mekim bai i stap hait. Na Papa bilong yu i save lukim ol samting i stap hait, em bai i bekim pe long yu."

ReferenceBlocks.text: When you pray, you shall not be as the hypocrites, for they love to stand and pray in the synagogues and in the corners of the streets, that they may be seen by men. Most certainly, I tell you, they have received their reward.

block.text: Jisas i tok moa olsem, "Taim yupela i mekim prea, yupela i no ken mekim olsem ol man bilong giaman i save mekim. Ol i laikim tumas long sanap na mekim prea insait long ol haus lotu, na long ol kona bilong bikrot, bai ol man i ken lukim ol. Mi tok tru long yupela, ol i kisim pinis pe bilong ol.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But you, when you pray, enter into your inner room, and having shut your door, pray to your Father who is in secret. Your Father who sees in secret will reward you openly.

block.text: Tasol taim yu laik mekim prea, yu mas i go insait long rum bilong yu na pasim dua na beten long Papa bilong yu i stap long ples hait. Na Papa bilong yu i save lukim ol samting i stap hait, em bai i bekim pe long yu.

ReferenceBlocks.text: In praying, don’t use vain repetitions, as the Gentiles do; for they think that they will be heard for their much speaking.

block.text: "Na taim yupela i mekim prea, maski long mekim planti toktok nating, olsem ol haiden i save mekim. Ol i ting sapos ol i mekim planti toktok bai God i harim ol.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Therefore don’t be like them, for your Father knows what things you need, before you ask him.

block.text: Yupela i no ken bihainim pasin bilong ol. Taim yupela i no opim maus yet long askim Papa bilong yupela long wanpela samting, em i save pinis long olgeta samting yupela i sot long en.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Pray like this: ‘Our Father in heaven, may your name be kept holy.

block.text: "Yupela i mas mekim kain prea olsem, 'Papa bilong mipela, yu stap long heven, nem bilong yu i mas i stap holi.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Let your Kingdom come. Let your will be done, as in heaven, so on earth.

block.text: Kingdom bilong yu i mas i kam. Mipela i mas bihainim laik bilong yu long graun olsem ol i save bihainim long heven.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Give us today our daily bread.

block.text: Nau yu ken givim mipela kaikai inap long dispela de.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Forgive us our debts, as we also forgive our debtors.

block.text: Na yu ken lusim ol rong bilong mipela, olsem mipela i save lusim ol rong ol arapela i mekim long mipela.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Bring us not into temptation, but deliver us from the evil one. For yours is the Kingdom, the power, and the glory forever. Amen.’

block.text: Na yu no ken larim ol traim i kamap long mipela, tasol yu ken tekewe mipela long ol samting nogut.'

ReferenceBlocks.text: For if you forgive men their trespasses, your heavenly Father will also forgive you.

block.text: "Harim. Sapos yupela i lusim rong bilong ol arapela manmeri, orait Papa bilong yupela long heven em bai i lusim rong bilong yupela tu.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But if you don’t forgive men their trespasses, neither will your Father forgive your trespasses.

block.text: Tasol sapos yupela i no lusim rong bilong ol arapela manmeri, orait Papa bilong yupela em tu bai i no lusim ol rong bilong yupela."

ReferenceBlocks.text: Moreover when you fast, don’t be like the hypocrites, with sad faces. For they disfigure their faces, that they may be seen by men to be fasting. Most certainly I tell you, they have received their reward.

block.text: Jisas i tok moa olsem, "Sapos yupela i tambu long kaikai, orait yupela i no ken mekim pes nogut olsem ol man bilong giaman i save mekim. Ol i save mekim pes nogut, bai ol manmeri i ken save ol i tambu long kaikai. Mi tok tru long yupela, ol i kisim pinis pe bilong ol.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But you, when you fast, anoint your head, and wash your face;

block.text: Tasol yu, sapos yu tambu long kaikai, yu mas putim wel long het bilong yu na wasim pes bilong yu.

ReferenceBlocks.text: that way you are not seen by men to be fasting, but by your Father who is in secret, and your Father, who sees in secret, will reward you.

block.text: Olsem bai ol man i no ken save yu tambu long kaikai. Papa bilong yu i stap hait, em wanpela tasol i ken save. Na Papa bilong yu i save lukim ol samting i stap hait, em bai i bekim pe long yu."

ReferenceBlocks.text: Don’t lay up treasures for yourselves on the earth, where moth and rust consume, and where thieves break through and steal;

block.text: Jisas i tok moa olsem, "Yupela i no ken bungim ol gutpela gutpela samting bilong yupela hia long dispela graun. Long dispela graun ol binatang na ros i save bagarapim ol samting, na ol stilman i save brukim banis na stilim.

ReferenceBlocks.text: but lay up for yourselves treasures in heaven, where neither moth nor rust consume, and where thieves don’t break through and steal.

block.text: Tasol yupela i mas bungim ol gutpela samting bilong yupela long heven. Long heven ol binatang na ros i no save bagarapim ol samting, na ol stilman i no save brukim banis na stilim.

ReferenceBlocks.text: For where your treasure is, there your heart will be also.

block.text: Long ples ol gutpela samting bilong yu i stap long en, long dispela ples tasol laik bilong yu tu bai i stap."

ReferenceBlocks.text: The lamp of the body is the eye. If therefore your eye is sound, your whole body will be full of light.

block.text: Jisas i tok moa olsem, "Ai em i lam bilong bodi. Sapos ai bilong yu i gutpela, orait lait bai i pulap long olgeta hap bodi bilong yu.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But if your eye is evil, your whole body will be full of darkness. If therefore the light that is in you is darkness, how great is the darkness!

block.text: Tasol sapos ai bilong yu i nogut, orait olgeta bodi bilong yu bai i tudak. Olsem na sapos dispela lait i stap insait long yu em i olsem tudak, bai dispela tudak em i bikpela moa."

ReferenceBlocks.text: No one can serve two masters, for either he will hate the one and love the other; or else he will be devoted to one and despise the other. You can’t serve both God and Mammon.

block.text: Jisas i tok moa olsem, "I no gat wanpela man inap i stap aninit long tupela bosman wantaim. Bai em i laikim wanpela na bel nogut long narapela. Bai em i harim tok bilong wanpela na givim baksait long narapela. Yupela i no inap i stap aninit long God na long mani wantaim."

ReferenceBlocks.text: Therefore I tell you, don’t be anxious for your life: what you will eat, or what you will drink; nor yet for your body, what you will wear. Isn’t life more than food, and the body more than clothing?

block.text: Jisas i tok moa olsem, "Olsem na mi tokim yupela, yupela i no ken tingting planti long laip bilong yupela na tok, 'Bai yumi kaikai wanem samting? Bai yumi dring wanem samting?' Na yupela i no ken tingting planti long bodi bilong yupela na tok, 'Bai yumi pasim wanem laplap?' Ating laip em i winim kaikai, na bodi em i winim ol laplap samting.

ReferenceBlocks.text: See the birds of the sky, that they don’t sow, neither do they reap, nor gather into barns. Your heavenly Father feeds them. Aren’t you of much more value than they?

block.text: Yupela lukim ol pisin. Ol i no save planim kaikai, na ol i no save bungim na putim long haus kaikai. Tasol Papa bilong yupela i stap long heven em i save givim kaikai long ol. Ating yupela i no winim tru ol pisin, a?

ReferenceBlocks.text: Which of you, by being anxious, can add one moment to his lifespan?

block.text: Na sapos wanpela bilong yupela i wok long tingting planti long rot bilong i stap gut, ating dispela pasin bilong tingting planti bai i skruim liklik hap taim moa long laip bilong en? I no inap tru.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Why are you anxious about clothing? Consider the lilies of the field, how they grow. They don’t toil, neither do they spin,

block.text: "Bilong wanem yupela i save tingting planti long ol klos samting? Yupela i mas lukim gut ol plaua i stap nabaut, ol i kamap olsem wanem. Ol i no save hatwok. Ol i no save wokim laplap.

ReferenceBlocks.text: yet I tell you that even Solomon in all his glory was not dressed like one of these.

block.text: Tasol mi tokim yupela, bipo King Solomon i save putim olgeta gutpela bilas bilong en, tasol gutpela bilas bilong ol dispela plaua i winim tru bilas bilong Solomon.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But if God so clothes the grass of the field, which today exists, and tomorrow is thrown into the oven, won’t he much more clothe you, you of little faith?

block.text: Nau ol dispela gras samting i stap nabaut, na tumora tasol ol man bai i katim na tromoi i go long paia. Na kain gras nating olsem, em God i save bilasim. Olsem na yupela ol manmeri i gat liklik bilip tasol, yupela i ken save tru olsem, God bai i givim bilas long yupela tu.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Therefore don’t be anxious, saying, ‘What will we eat?’, ‘What will we drink?’ or, ‘With what will we be clothed?’

block.text: Yupela i no ken tingting planti na tok, 'Bai yumi kaikai wanem samting? Bai yumi dring wanem samting?' Nogat.

ReferenceBlocks.text: For the Gentiles seek after all these things; for your heavenly Father knows that you need all these things.

block.text: Ol haiden i save wari long painim olgeta dispela samting. Tasol Papa bilong yupela i stap long heven em i save pinis, yupela i mas kisim dispela olgeta kain samting.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But seek first God’s Kingdom, and his righteousness; and all these things will be given to you as well.

block.text: Tasol namba wan samting yupela i mas mekim i olsem. Yupela i mas larim God i stap king bilong yupela, na kisim stretpela pasin bilong em, na bai em i givim dispela olgeta arapela samting tu long yupela.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Therefore don’t be anxious for tomorrow, for tomorrow will be anxious for itself. Each day’s own evil is sufficient.”

block.text: Olsem na yupela i no ken tingting tumas long tumora. De tumora em i ken tingting long samting bilong em yet. Hevi bilong wanpela de em inap long dispela de tasol."

ReferenceBlocks.text: MATTHEW 7
“Don’t judge, so that you won’t be judged.

block.text: Jisas i tok moa olsem, "Yupela i no ken skelim pasin bilong ol arapela na tok ol i man nogut. Nogut God i mekim wankain pasin long yupela tu.

ReferenceBlocks.text: For with whatever judgment you judge, you will be judged; and with whatever measure you measure, it will be measured to you.

block.text: God bai i skelim pasin bilong yupela long wankain pasin olsem yupela i save mekim long ol arapela man. Na skel yupela i save givim long ol arapela man, long dispela skel tasol God bai i bekim long yupela.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Why do you see the speck that is in your brother’s eye, but don’t consider the beam that is in your own eye?

block.text: Bilong wanem yu lukim liklik hap pipia i stap long ai bilong brata bilong yu, tasol yu no tingim bikpela plang i stap long ai bilong yu yet?

ReferenceBlocks.text: Or how will you tell your brother, ‘Let me remove the speck from your eye;’ and behold, the beam is in your own eye?

block.text: Sapos plang i stap long ai bilong yu yet, orait olsem wanem na yu inap tokim brata bilong yu, 'Brata, mi laik kamautim pipia i stap long ai bilong yu'?

ReferenceBlocks.text: You hypocrite! First remove the beam out of your own eye, and then you can see clearly to remove the speck out of your brother’s eye.

block.text: Yu man bilong giaman, pastaim yu mas kamautim bikpela plang i stap long ai bilong yu yet. Na bihain bai yu inap lukluk gut na kamautim liklik hap pipia i stap long ai bilong brata bilong yu.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Don’t give that which is holy to the dogs, neither throw your pearls before the pigs, lest perhaps they trample them under their feet, and turn and tear you to pieces.

block.text: "Yupela i no ken kisim samting ol i makim bilong God, na givim long ol dok. Nogut ol i tanim na kaikaim yupela. Na yupela i no ken tromoi ol gutpela gutpela bis bilong yupela i go long ol pik. Nogut ol i krungutim tasol long lek bilong ol."

ReferenceBlocks.text: Ask, and it will be given you. Seek, and you will find. Knock, and it will be opened for you.

block.text: Jisas i tok moa olsem, "Yupela i mas prea na askim God long givim ol samting long yupela, na em bai i givim long yupela. Yupela i mas wok long painim samting na bai yupela i lukim. Yupela i mas paitim dua, na God bai i opim long yupela.

ReferenceBlocks.text: For everyone who asks receives. He who seeks finds. To him who knocks it will be opened.

block.text: Olgeta man i prea long God, ol i save kisim ol samting. Man i wok long painim samting, em i save lukim. Na man i paitim dua, God bai i opim dua long em.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Or who is there among you, who, if his son asks him for bread, will give him a stone?

block.text: "Sapos pikinini bilong wanpela bilong yupela em i askim papa long givim bret long em, ating papa bai i givim wanpela ston long em, a? Nogat.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Or if he asks for a fish, who will give him a serpent?

block.text: Na sapos pikinini i askim papa long givim pis long em, ating papa bai i givim em wanpela snek nogut, a? Em tu nogat.

ReferenceBlocks.text: If you then, being evil, know how to give good gifts to your children, how much more will your Father who is in heaven give good things to those who ask him!

block.text: Yupela papa i save mekim planti pasin nogut, tasol yupela i save tumas long givim ol gutpela samting long ol pikinini bilong yupela. Olsem na yupela i ken save tru, Papa bilong yupela i stap long heven em bai i amamas long givim ol gutpela samting long ol man i prea long em.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Therefore whatever you desire for men to do to you, you shall also do to them; for this is the law and the prophets.

block.text: "Olgeta pasin yupela i laik bai ol arapela manmeri i mas mekim long yupela, ol dispela pasin tasol yupela i mas mekim long ol. Dispela em i as tok bilong lo, na em i as bilong tok bilong ol profet."

ReferenceBlocks.text: Enter in by the narrow gate; for wide is the gate and broad is the way that leads to destruction, and many are those who enter in by it.

block.text: Jisas i tok moa olsem, "Yupela i mas i go insait long liklik dua. Dua i go long ples bilong lus, em i bikpela, na rot i go long dispela ples em i op tumas na em i isi long bihainim. Na planti manmeri i save bihainim dispela rot.

ReferenceBlocks.text: How narrow is the gate, and restricted is the way that leads to life! Few are those who find it.

block.text: Tasol dua i go long ples bilong kisim laip, em i liklik tru, na rot i go long dispela ples em i hat tru long bihainim. Na wanpela wanpela manmeri tasol i save lukim na bihainim dispela rot."

ReferenceBlocks.text: Beware of false prophets, who come to you in sheep’s clothing, but inwardly are ravening wolves.

block.text: Jisas i tok moa olsem, "Yupela lukaut long ol giaman profet. Ol i save mekim gutpela tok bilong grisim yupela, tasol tingting tru bilong ol em i bilong paulim yupela na bagarapim yupela. Ol i olsem ol weldok i pasim skin bilong sipsip, bai ol i ken i go klostu long ol sipsip na holimpas ol.

ReferenceBlocks.text: By their fruits you will know them. Do you gather grapes from thorns, or figs from thistles?

block.text: Yupela lukim pasin bilong ol na bai yupela i save, ol i giaman profet, o nogat. Olsem wanem? Ating ol man i save go long rop i gat nil bilong kisim ol pikinini bilong diwai wain, a? Na sapos ol man i laik kisim pikinini bilong diwai fik, ating ol i save go long gras nogut i gat mosong, a? Nogat tru.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Even so, every good tree produces good fruit; but the corrupt tree produces evil fruit.

block.text: Olsem tasol olgeta gutpela diwai i save karim gutpela kaikai. Na diwai nogut i save karim kaikai nogut.

ReferenceBlocks.text: A good tree can’t produce evil fruit, neither can a corrupt tree produce good fruit.

block.text: Gutpela diwai em i no inap karim kaikai nogut. Na diwai nogut em i no inap karim gutpela kaikai.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Every tree that doesn’t grow good fruit is cut down, and thrown into the fire.

block.text: Olgeta diwai i no save karim gutpela kaikai, em ol i save katim na tromoi i go long paia.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Therefore by their fruits you will know them.

block.text: Olsem na yupela i mas lukim pasin bilong ol yet na bai yupela i save long ol giaman profet.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Not everyone who says to me, ‘Lord, Lord,’ will enter into the Kingdom of Heaven; but he who does the will of my Father who is in heaven.

block.text: "Yupela i no ken ting, olgeta manmeri i save kolim mi, 'Bikpela, Bikpela,' ol bai i go insait long kingdom bilong heven. Nogat. Man i bihainim laik bilong Papa bilong mi i stap long heven, em tasol bai i go insait long kingdom.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Many will tell me in that day, ‘Lord, Lord, didn’t we prophesy in your name, in your name cast out demons, and in your name do many mighty works?’

block.text: Long de bilong bikpela kot bilong God, planti manmeri bai i tokim mi olsem, 'Bikpela, Bikpela, mipela i bin mekim wok profet long nem bilong yu. Long nem bilong yu mipela i bin rausim ol spirit nogut. Long nem bilong yu mipela i bin wokim planti mirakel.'

ReferenceBlocks.text: Then I will tell them, ‘I never knew you. Depart from me, you who work iniquity.’

block.text: Na long dispela taim mi bai tokaut long ol olsem, 'Mi no save liklik long yupela. Yupela ol man bilong mekim pasin nogut, yupela klia long mi.' "

ReferenceBlocks.text: Everyone therefore who hears these words of mine, and does them, I will liken him to a wise man, who built his house on a rock.

block.text: Jisas i tok moa olsem, "Orait man i harim dispela tok bilong mi na i bihainim, em i olsem wanpela man i gat gutpela tingting, na em i wokim haus bilong en antap long ples ston.

ReferenceBlocks.text: The rain came down, the floods came, and the winds blew, and beat on that house; and it didn’t fall, for it was founded on the rock.

block.text: Na ren i kam daun, na tait bilong wara i kamap, na win i kirap strong, na ol dispela samting i sakim dispela haus. Tasol em i no pundaun, long wanem, simen bilong dispela haus em i pas strong tru long bikpela bikpela ston insait long graun.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Everyone who hears these words of mine, and doesn’t do them will be like a foolish man, who built his house on the sand.

block.text: Tasol man i harim dispela tok bilong mi na i no bihainim, em i olsem wanpela longlong man i sanapim haus bilong en antap long wesan tasol.

ReferenceBlocks.text: The rain came down, the floods came, and the winds blew, and beat on that house; and it fell--and great was its fall.”

block.text: Na ren i kam daun, na tait bilong wara i kamap, na win i kirap strong. Na ol dispela samting i sakim dispela haus, na em i pundaun. Yes, em i pundaun nogut tru."

ReferenceBlocks.text: It happened, when Jesus had finished saying these things, that the multitudes were astonished at his teaching.

block.text: Jisas i autim pinis ol dispela tok, orait ol bikpela lain manmeri ol i kirap nogut tru long skul bilong en.

ReferenceBlocks.text: He taught them as one who had authority, and not like the scribes.

block.text: Long wanem, em i no skulim ol olsem ol saveman bilong lo i save mekim. Nogat. Em I skulim ol olsem man i gat namba.

ReferenceBlocks.text: MATTHEW 8
When he came down from the mountain, great multitudes followed him.

block.text: Jisas i lusim maunten na i go daun, na planti manmeri moa I bihainim em i go.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Behold, a leper came to him and worshiped him, saying,

block.text: Na wanpela man i gat sik lepra i kam long Jisas na i brukim skru na i tok,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Lord, if you want to, you can make me clean.”

block.text: "Bikpela, sapos yu laik, yu inap long mekim mi i kamap klin long ai bilong God."

ReferenceBlocks.text: Jesus stretched out his hand, and touched him, saying,

block.text: Na Jisas i putim han long dispela man na i tok,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “I want to... Be made clean.”

block.text: "Mi laik. Yu kamap klin."

ReferenceBlocks.text: Immediately his leprosy was cleansed.
Jesus said to him,

block.text: Orait wantu sik lepra bilong en i pinis, na dispela man i kamap klin.
Na Jisas i tokim em olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “See that you tell nobody, but go, show yourself to the priest, and offer the gift that Moses commanded, as a testimony to them.”

block.text: "Lukaut gut. Yu no ken tokim wanpela man long dispela samting i bin kamap long yu. Nogat. Yu go soim skin bilong yu long pris, na mekim ofa olsem bipo Moses i bin tok. Na bai ol man i ken save, sik bilong yu i pinis."

ReferenceBlocks.text: When he came into Capernaum, a centurion came to him, asking him,
and saying,

block.text: Jisas i go insait long taun Kaperneam, na wanpela kepten bilong 100 soldia bilong ol Rom em i kam na askim Jisas strong olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Lord, my servant lies in the house paralyzed, grievously tormented.”

block.text: "Bikpela, wokboi bilong mi em i sik na i slip i stap long haus. Bun bilong en i dai olgeta, na em i gat bikpela pen moa."

ReferenceBlocks.text: Jesus said to him,

block.text: Orait Jisas i tokim em,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “I will come and heal him.”

block.text: "Bai mi go mekim em i kamap orait."

ReferenceBlocks.text: The centurion answered,

block.text: Tasol kepten i bekim tok bilong em olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Lord, I’m not worthy for you to come under my roof. Just say the word, and my servant will be healed.

block.text: "Bikpela, mi no gutpela man inap long yu kam insait long haus bilong mi. Yu tok tasol, na wokboi bilong mi bai i orait gen.

ReferenceBlocks.text: For I am also a man under authority, having under myself soldiers. I tell this one, ‘Go,’ and he goes; and tell another, ‘Come,’ and he comes; and tell my servant, ‘Do this,’ and he does it.”

block.text: Mi tok olsem, long wanem, mi tu mi stap aninit long ol man i gat namba bilong bosim mi. Na mi yet mi gat ol soldia i stap aninit long mi. Na sapos mi tokim wanpela, 'Yu go,' orait em i save go. Na sapos mi tokim narapela, 'Yu kam,' orait em i save kam. Na taim mi tokim wokboi bilong mi, 'Yu mekim dispela wok,' orait em i save mekim."

ReferenceBlocks.text: When Jesus heard it, he marveled, and said to those who followed,

block.text: Jisas i harim dispela tok na em i kirap nogut. Na em i tokim ol man i bihainim em olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Most certainly I tell you, I haven’t found so great a faith, not even in Israel.

block.text: "Mi tok tru long yupela, mi no bin lukim wanpela man namel long ol lain Israel i gat kain bilip olsem bilong dispela man.

ReferenceBlocks.text: I tell you that many will come from the east and the west, and will sit down with Abraham, Isaac, and Jacob in the Kingdom of Heaven,

block.text: "Na mi tokim yupela, planti manmeri bai i lusim ol kantri i stap long hap sankamap na hap san i go daun, na ol bai i kam sindaun long kaikai wantaim Abraham na Aisak na Jekop insait long kingdom bilong heven.

ReferenceBlocks.text: but the children of the Kingdom will be thrown out into the outer darkness. There will be weeping and gnashing of teeth.”

block.text: Tasol ol manmeri pastaim God i bin makim bilong i stap long kingdom bilong en, God bai i rausim ol i go long ples tudak. Na long dispela hap ol bai i krai nogut na skrapim tit bilong ol."

ReferenceBlocks.text: Jesus said to the centurion,

block.text: Na Jisas i tokim dispela kepten olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Go your way. Let it be done for you as you have believed.”

block.text: "Yu go nau. Na ol samting i ken kamap long yu olsem yu bilip pinis."

ReferenceBlocks.text: His servant was healed in that hour.

block.text: Na long dispela taim stret, wokboi bilong kepten i kamap orait gen.

ReferenceBlocks.text: When Jesus came into Peter’s house, he saw his wife’s mother lying sick with a fever.

block.text: Orait Jisas i go insait long haus bilong Pita, na em i lukim mama bilong meri bilong Pita i slip i stap long bet, long wanem, em i gat sik na skin bilong en i hat.

ReferenceBlocks.text: He touched her hand, and the fever left her. She got up and served him.

block.text: Na Jisas i holim han bilong en, na sik i lusim em. Na em i kirap na i redim kaikai bilong Jisas.

ReferenceBlocks.text: When evening came, they brought to him many possessed with demons. He cast out the spirits with a word, and healed all who were sick.

block.text: Long apinun ol i bringim planti manmeri i gat spirit nogut i stap long ol, na ol i kam long Jisas. Na em i tok na ol spirit nogut i lusim ol dispela manmeri. Na em i mekim orait olgeta sikman.

ReferenceBlocks.text: This was to fulfill what was spoken through Isaiah the prophet, saying:

block.text: Na long dispela pasin em inapim wanpela tok God i bin mekim long maus bilong profet Aisaia. Em i tok olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “He took our infirmities, and bore our diseases.”

block.text: "Em yet i kisim ol kain kain sik bilong yumi na rausim i go pinis."

ReferenceBlocks.text: Now when Jesus saw great multitudes around him, he gave the order to depart to the other side.

block.text: Jisas i lukim ol bikpela lain manmeri i sanap raunim em I stap, na em i tokim ol disaipel bilong en olsem, "Yumi go long hapsait bilong raunwara."

ReferenceBlocks.text: A scribe came, and said to him,

block.text: Na wanpela saveman bilong lo i kam na i tokim Jisas olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Teacher, I will follow you wherever you go.”

block.text: "Tisa, olgeta ples yu go long en, bai mi bihainim yu i go wantaim."

ReferenceBlocks.text: Jesus said to him,

block.text: Na Jisas i tokim em olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “The foxes have holes, and the birds of the sky have nests, but the Son of Man has nowhere to lay his head.”

block.text: "Ol weldok i gat hul long graun, na ol pisin i gat haus bilong ol. Tasol Pikinini Bilong Man em i no gat ples bilong slip."

ReferenceBlocks.text: Another of his disciples said to him,

block.text: Na narapela man, em wanpela bilong ol disaipel, em i tokim Jisas olsem,

block.characterId: disciple who wanted to bury his father

ReferenceBlocks.characterId: disciple who wanted to bury his father
ReferenceBlocks.text: “Lord, allow me first to go and bury my father.”

block.text: "Bikman, larim mi i go planim papa bilong mi pastaim."

ReferenceBlocks.text: But Jesus said to him,

block.text: Tasol Jisas i tokim em,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Follow me, and leave the dead to bury their own dead.”

block.text: "Maski. Ol man i dai pinis, ol i ken planim ol lain bilong ol yet. Yu kam bihainim mi."

ReferenceBlocks.text: When he got into a boat, his disciples followed him.

block.text: Orait Jisas i kalap long bot, na ol disaipel bilong en i bihainim em.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Behold, a violent storm came up on the sea, so much that the boat was covered with the waves, but he was asleep.

block.text: Ol i go namel long raunwara na bikpela win tru i kirap na si i laik karamapim bot. Tasol Jisas i slip i stap.

ReferenceBlocks.text: They came to him, and woke him up, saying,

block.text: Na ol i go kirapim em, na i tok,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Save us, Lord! We are dying!”

block.text: "Bikpela, helpim mipela. Yumi laik lus nau."

ReferenceBlocks.text: He said to them,

block.text: Na em i tokim ol olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Why are you so afraid O you of little faith?”

block.text: "Bilip bilong yupela em i liklik tru. Watpo yupela i pret?"

ReferenceBlocks.text: Then he got up, rebuked the wind and the sea, and there was a great calm.

block.text: Na em i kirap na i krosim win wantaim si. Na win i dai, na wara i no mekim nais liklik.

ReferenceBlocks.text: The men marveled, saying,

block.text: Na ol i tingting planti, na ol i tok,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “What kind of man is this, that even the wind and the sea obey him?”

block.text: "Dispela em i wanem kain man, na win wantaim wara i harim tok bilong em?"

ReferenceBlocks.text: When he came to the other side, into the country of the Gergesenes, two demon possessed men coming out of the tombs met him there. They were so violent that no one could pass that way.
Behold, they cried out, saying,

block.text: Jisas i go kamap long hapsait bilong raunwara Galili, long graun bilong ol Gadara. Na tupela man i gat spirit nogut, tupela i kam bungim em. Tupela i stap nabaut long ples matmat na i kam. Tupela i wel nogut tru, olsem na ol manmeri i no inap wokabaut long dispela rot.
Orait tupela i singaut strong olsem,

block.characterId: demons (Legion)/man delivered from Legion of demons

ReferenceBlocks.characterId: demons (Legion)/man delivered from Legion of demons
ReferenceBlocks.text: “What do we have to do with you, Jesus, Son of God? Have you come here to torment us before the time?”

block.text: "Yu Pikinini Bilong God, yu laik mekim wanem long mipela? Taim i no yet, na yu kam hia bilong mekim nogut long mipela, a?"

ReferenceBlocks.text: Now there was a herd of many pigs feeding far away from them.

block.text: Wanpela bikpela lain pik i stap longwe liklik na i kaikai i stap.

ReferenceBlocks.text: The demons begged him, saying,

block.text: Na ol spirit nogut i singaut strong long Jisas olsem,

block.characterId: demons (Legion)/man delivered from Legion of demons

ReferenceBlocks.characterId: demons (Legion)/man delivered from Legion of demons
ReferenceBlocks.text: “If you cast us out, permit us to go away into the herd of pigs.”

block.text: "Sapos yu rausim mipela, yu mas larim mipela i go insait long ol dispela lain pik."

ReferenceBlocks.text: He said to them,

block.text: Na Jisas i tokim ol olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Go!”

block.text: "Yupela go."

ReferenceBlocks.text: They came out,
and went into the herd of pigs: and behold, the whole herd of pigs rushed
down the cliff into the sea,
and died in the water.

block.text: Orait ol spirit nogut i lusim
dispela tupela man, na ol i go insait long ol pik. Na dispela olgeta lain pik i ran strong tru
i go daun long wanpela ples nogut. Na ol i pundaun long raunwara,
na ol i dring wara na i dai.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Those who fed them fled, and went away into the city, and told everything, including what happened to those who were possessed with demons.

block.text: Ol wasman bilong pik i lukim na ol i ranawe. Ol i go kamap long taun na tokim ol manmeri long ol samting i bin kamap. Na ol i stori long samting i kamap long tupela man i gat spirit nogut.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Behold, all the city came out to meet Jesus. When they saw him, they begged him saying:

block.text: Orait na olgeta manmeri bilong dispela taun i kam long Jisas. Na taim ol i lukim em, ol i tok strong long em

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Depart from our borders.”

block.text: i mas lusim graun bilong ol na i go long narapela hap.

ReferenceBlocks.text: MATTHEW 9
He entered into a boat, and crossed over, and came into his own city.

block.text: Orait Jisas i kalap long wanpela bot, na i go bek long hapsait bilong raunwara, na i kamap long ples bilong em stret.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Behold, they brought to him a man who was paralyzed, lying on a bed. Jesus, seeing their faith, said to the paralytic,

block.text: Na ol I karim wanpela sikman i kam long em, bun bilong en i dai olgeta, na em i slip i stap long bet. Na Jisas i lukim olsem ol i bilip tru, na em i tokim dispela sikman olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Son, cheer up! Your sins are forgiven you.”

block.text: "Pikinini, bel bilong yu i ken i stap isi. Mi lusim pinis ol sin bilong yu."

ReferenceBlocks.text: Behold, some of the scribes said to themselves,

block.text: Sampela saveman bilong lo ol i harim dispela tok bilong Jisas, na ol i toktok namel long ol yet olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “This man blasphemes.”

block.text: "Dispela man em i kisim ples bilong God."

ReferenceBlocks.text: Jesus, knowing their thoughts, said,

block.text: Jisas i save pinis long tingting bilong ol, na em i tok,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Why do you think evil in your hearts?

block.text: "Bilong wanem yupela i gat dispela tingting nogut long bel bilong yupela?

ReferenceBlocks.text: For which is easier, to say, ‘Your sins are forgiven;’ or to say, ‘Get up, and walk?’

block.text: Wanem tok em i isi long mi mekim? Em i isi long mi tok, 'Mi lusim ol sin bilong yu,' o em i isi long mi tok, 'Yu kirap na wokabaut'?

ReferenceBlocks.text: But that you may know that the Son of Man has authority on earth to forgive sins...”

block.text: Tasol mi laik bai yupela i save olsem, Pikinini Bilong Man em i gat strong long dispela graun, na em inap long lusim ol sin."

ReferenceBlocks.text: (then he said to the paralytic),

block.text: Jisas i tok pinis, na em i lukluk i go long dispela man, bun bilong en i dai olgeta, na i tokim em olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Get up, and take up your mat, and go up to your house.”

block.text: "Yu kirap na kisim bet bilong yu, na yu go long haus bilong yu."

ReferenceBlocks.text: He arose and departed to his house.

block.text: Na dispela man i kirap, na i go long haus bilong en.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But when the multitudes saw it, they marveled and glorified God, who had given such authority to men.
