block.text: Ol manmeri i lukim dispela na ol i pret. Na ol i litimapim nem bilong God, long wanem, em i bin givim dispela kain namba na strong long ol man.

ReferenceBlocks.text: As Jesus passed by from there, he saw a man called Matthew sitting at the tax collection office. He said to him,

block.text: Jisas i wokabaut i go, na em i lukim wanpela man, nem bilong en Matyu, i sindaun i stap long haus takis. Na Jisas i tokim em olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Follow me.”

block.text: "Yu kam bihainim mi."

ReferenceBlocks.text: He got up and followed him.

block.text: Na Matyu i kirap i go bihainim Jisas.

ReferenceBlocks.text: It happened as he sat in the house, behold, many tax collectors and sinners came and sat down with Jesus and his disciples.

block.text: Na Jisas i sindaun kaikai long haus, na planti man bilong kisim takis na planti man bilong mekim sin ol i kam. Ol i sindaun kaikai wantaim Jisas na ol disaipel bilong em.

ReferenceBlocks.text: When the Pharisees saw it, they said to his disciples,

block.text: Ol Farisi i lukim dispela, na ol i askim ol disaipel bilong Jisas olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Why does your teacher eat with tax collectors and sinners?”

block.text: "Watpo tisa bilong yupela em i save kaikai wantaim ol man bilong kisim takis na ol man bilong mekim sin?"

ReferenceBlocks.text: When Jesus heard it, he said to them,

block.text: Jisas i harim dispela tok, na em i tok olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Those who are healthy have no need for a physician, but those who are sick do.

block.text: "Ol man i no gat sik, ol i no save go long dokta. Nogat. Ol sikman tasol i save go long dokta.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But you go and learn what this means: ‘I desire mercy, and not sacrifice,’ for I came not to call the righteous, but sinners to repentance.”

block.text: Yupela go kisim save long dispela tok i stap long buk bilong God, 'Mi no laikim ol ofa nating yupela i save mekim. Mi laikim tumas bai yupela i mekim gutpela pasin long ol arapela.'" Na Jisas i tok moa olsem, "Mi no kam bilong singautim ol stretpela man. Nogat. Mi kam bilong singautim ol man i save mekim sin."

ReferenceBlocks.text: Then John’s disciples came to him, saying,

block.text: Long dispela taim ol disaipel bilong Jon i kam long Jisas na i askim em olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Why do we and the Pharisees fast often, but your disciples don’t fast?”

block.text: "Olsem wanem na mipela wantaim ol Farisi mipela i save tambu long kaikai, tasol ol disaipel bilong yu ol i no save tambu long kaikai?"

ReferenceBlocks.text: Jesus said to them,

block.text: Na Jisas i tokim ol olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Can the friends of the bridegroom mourn, as long as the bridegroom is with them? But the days will come when the bridegroom will be taken away from them, and then they will fast.

block.text: "Sapos wanpela man i laik marit, ating ol wantok bilong en inap bel hevi long taim em i stap yet wantaim ol? Nogat. Tasol bihain, taim ol i kisim dispela man i go pinis na em i no moa i stap wantaim ol wantok bilong en, orait ol bai i tambu long kaikai.

ReferenceBlocks.text: No one puts a piece of unshrunk cloth on an old garment; for the patch would tear away from the garment, and a worse hole is made.

block.text: "I no gat man i save kisim hap nupela laplap bilong samapim hul long olpela saket. Sapos em i mekim olsem, orait taim ol i wasim saket dispela laplap bilong pasim hul em bai i go liklik na brukim saket gen, na hul bai i kamap bikpela moa.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Neither do people put new wine into old wineskins, or else the skins would burst, and the wine be spilled, and the skins ruined. No, they put new wine into fresh wineskins, and both are preserved.”

block.text: Na i no gat man i save pulimapim nupela wain long olpela skin meme. Sapos ol i mekim olsem, orait skin meme bai i bruk, na wain bai i kapsait i go long graun, na skin meme tu bai i bagarap. Olsem na ol i save pulimapim nupela wain long nupela skin meme, na tupela wantaim i stap gut." klos bilong en

ReferenceBlocks.text: While he told these things to them, behold, a ruler came and worshiped him, saying,

block.text: Jisas i toktok yet long ol disaipel bilong Jon na wanpela hetman i kam na i brukim skru klostu long lek bilong Jisas na i tok,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “My daughter has just died, but come and lay your hand on her, and she will live.”

block.text: "Pikinini meri bilong mi nau tasol i dai pinis. Tasol yu kam putim han long em, na bai em i gat laip gen."

ReferenceBlocks.text: Jesus got up and followed him, as did his disciples.

block.text: Na Jisas i kirap na bihainim em i go, na ol disaipel bilong en i go wantaim.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Behold, a woman who had an issue of blood for twelve years came behind him and touched the fringe of his garment.
She thought to herself,

block.text: Na wanpela meri i stap, em i save karim blut oltaim na i stap olsem inap long 12 -pela yia. Dispela meri i kam klostu long baksait bilong Jisas, na i putim han long arere bilong longpela klos bilong Jisas.
Em i bin tokim em yet olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “If I just touch his garment, I will be made well.”

block.text: "Sapos mi putim han tasol long klos bilong en, bai mi orait gen."

ReferenceBlocks.text: But Jesus, turning around and seeing her, said,

block.text: Tasol Jisas i tanim na I lukim em, na i tok,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Daughter, cheer up! Your faith has made you well.”

block.text: "Pikinini, bel bilong yu i ken i stap isi. Yu bilip long mi, olsem na yu kamap orait gen."

ReferenceBlocks.text: And the woman was made well from that hour.

block.text: Na long dispela taim tasol meri i kamap orait gen.

ReferenceBlocks.text: When Jesus came into the ruler’s house and saw the flute players and the noisy crowd,
he said to them,

block.text: Orait Jisas i go kamap long haus bilong dispela hetman, na em i lukim ol manmeri i krai i stap. Ol man i wok long winim mambu, na ol manmeri i mekim bikpela nois.
Na Jisas i tok,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Go away. The girl isn’t dead, but sleeping.”

block.text: "Yupela klia na I go. Liklik meri i no i dai. Nogat. Em i slip tasol."

ReferenceBlocks.text: They mocked him, saying:

block.text: Na ol i lap nogut long em.

ReferenceBlocks.text: “The girl is dead!”

block.text: "The Girl is dead!"

ReferenceBlocks.text: But when the crowd was put out, he entered in, took her by the hand, and the girl arose.

block.text: Tasol ol i rausim ol manmeri i go ausait, na Jisas i go insait na i holim han bilong dispela yangpela meri, na em i kirap.

ReferenceBlocks.text: The report of this went out into all that land.

block.text: Na tok bilong dispela samting Jisas i mekim i go nabaut long olgeta hap bilong dispela distrik.

ReferenceBlocks.text: As Jesus passed by from there, two blind men followed him, calling out and saying,

block.text: Jisas i lusim dispela ples na i wokabaut i go. Na tupela man aipas i bihainim em na i singaut olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Have mercy on us, son of David!”

block.text: "Yu Pikinini Bilong Devit, yu mas sori long mitupela."

ReferenceBlocks.text: When he had come into the house, the blind men came to him. Jesus said to them,

block.text: Em i go insait long haus, na dispela tupela aipas i kam long em. Na Jisas i askim tupela olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Do you believe that I am able to do this?”

block.text: "Yutupela I bilip olsem mi inap mekim dispela samting, o nogat?"

ReferenceBlocks.text: They told him,

block.text: Na tupela i tokim em,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Yes, Lord.”

block.text: "Yes, Bikpela. Mipela i bilip."

ReferenceBlocks.text: Then he touched their eyes, saying,

block.text: Orait na em i putim han long ai bilong tupela na i tok olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “According to your faith be it done to you.”

block.text: "Yutupela i bilip long mi. Olsem tasol dispela samting i ken kamap long yutupela."

ReferenceBlocks.text: Their eyes were opened. Jesus strictly commanded them, saying,

block.text: Na ai bilong tupela i op. Na Jisas i givim strongpela tok long tupela olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “See that no one knows about this.”

block.text: "Yutupela i no ken tru larim wanpela man i save long dispela samting i bin kamap long yutupela."

ReferenceBlocks.text: But they went out and spread abroad his fame in all that land.

block.text: Tasol tupela i go na tokim ol manmeri long olgeta hap bilong dispela distrik long ol gutpela wok Jisas i save mekim.

ReferenceBlocks.text: As they went out, behold, a mute man who was demon possessed was brought to him.

block.text: Taim dispela tupela man i lusim Jisas na i go, ol manmeri i kisim wanpela man mauspas i gat spirit nogut i stap long em, na bringim em i kam long Jisas.

ReferenceBlocks.text: When the demon was cast out, the mute man spoke. The multitudes marveled, saying,

block.text: Orait na Jisas i rausim dispela spirit nogut, na dispela mauspas i toktok. Na ol manmeri i tingting planti na i tok,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Nothing like this has ever been seen in Israel!”

block.text: "Bipo i no gat kain samting olsem i kamap long kantri Israel."

ReferenceBlocks.text: But the Pharisees said,

block.text: Tasol ol Farisi i tok,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “By the prince of the demons, he casts out demons.”

block.text: "Em i save rausim ol spirit nogut long strong bilong hetman bilong ol spirit nogut."

ReferenceBlocks.text: Jesus went about all the cities and the villages, teaching in their synagogues, and preaching the Good News of the Kingdom, and healing every disease and every sickness among the people.

block.text: Jisas i go raun long olgeta taun na ples. Em i skulim ol manmeri insait long ol haus lotu bilong ol. Em i autim gutnius bilong kingdom bilong God, na em i mekim orait olgeta kain sik i stap long bodi bilong ol.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But when he saw the multitudes, he was moved with compassion for them, because they were harassed and scattered, like sheep without a shepherd.

block.text: Em i lukim ol bikpela lain manmeri, na em i sori tru long ol, long wanem, tingting bilong ol i paul nabaut, na ol i stap nogut tru, olsem ol sipsip i no gat wasman.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Then he said to his disciples,

block.text: Olsem na em i tokim ol disaipel bilong en olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “The harvest indeed is plentiful, but the laborers are few.

block.text: "Planti kaikai tumas i mau pinis long gaden, tasol i no gat planti wokman i stap bilong kisim.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Pray therefore that the Lord of the harvest will send out laborers into his harvest.”

block.text: Olsem na yupela i mas beten long Papa bilong gaden, bai em i salim ol wokman i go bungim kaikai bilong en."

ReferenceBlocks.text: MATTHEW 10
He called to himself his twelve disciples, and gave them authority over unclean spirits, to cast them out, and to heal every disease and every sickness.

block.text: Jisas i singautim ol 12 -pela disaipel bilong en i kam, na em i givim strong long ol bilong rausim ol spirit nogut i stap long ol manmeri, na bilong mekim orait olgeta kain sik bilong ol manmeri.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Now the names of the twelve apostles are these. The first, Simon, who is called Peter; Andrew, his brother; James the son of Zebedee; John, his brother;

block.text: Nem bilong ol 12 -pela aposel em i olsem. Namba wan em Saimon, em i gat narapela nem Pita, na brata bilong en Andru. Na Jems, pikinini bilong Sebedi, wantaim brata bilong en Jon.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Philip; Bartholomew; Thomas; Matthew the tax collector; James the son of Alphaeus; Lebbaeus, whose surname was Thaddaeus;

block.text: Na Filip na Bartolomyu na Tomas na Matyu, em man bilong kisim takis. Na Jems, em pikinini bilong Alfius, na Tadius

ReferenceBlocks.text: Simon the Canaanite; and Judas Iscariot, who also betrayed him.

block.text: na Saimon, em wanpela man bilong lain Selot, na Judas Iskariot, em dispela man bihain em i givim Jisas long han bilong ol man i laik mekim nogut long em.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Jesus sent these twelve out, and commanded them, saying,

block.text: Jisas i salim dispela 12 -pela man i go, na em i givim toktok long ol olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Don’t go among the Gentiles, and don’t enter into any city of the Samaritans.

block.text: "Yupela i no ken i go long ol man bilong ol arapela lain. Na yupela i no ken i go insait long taun bilong ol Samaria. Nogat.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Rather, go to the lost sheep of the house of Israel.

block.text: Yupela i mas i go long ol sipsip bilong lain Israel, ol i lus pinis.

ReferenceBlocks.text: As you go, preach, saying, ‘The Kingdom of Heaven is at hand!’

block.text: Yupela go na autim tok olsem, 'Kingdom bilong heven em i kam klostu pinis.'

ReferenceBlocks.text: Heal the sick, cleanse the lepers, and cast out demons. Freely you received, so freely give.

block.text: Yupela go mekim orait ol sikman, na kirapim ol man i dai pinis, na mekim ol man i gat sik lepra i kamap klin, na rausim ol spirit nogut i stap long ol manmeri. Samting yupela i bin kisim, em yupela i kisim nating, na i no gat pe bilong en. Olsem na yupela i mas givim nating long ol manmeri. Yupela i no ken kisim pe long en.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Don’t take any gold, nor silver, nor brass in your money belts.

block.text: "Yupela i no ken karim gol o mani silva o mani kapa long poket bilong yupela.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Take no bag for your journey, neither two coats, nor shoes, nor staff: for the laborer is worthy of his food.

block.text: Taim yupela i wokabaut yupela i no ken karim hanbek. Na yupela i no ken kisim tupela siot na su na stik bilong wokabaut i go wantaim yupela. Nogat. Man i save wok, em ol i mas givim em ol kaikai samting bilong en.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Into whatever city or village you enter, find out who in it is worthy; and stay there until you go on.

block.text: "Sapos yupela i go insait long wanpela taun o wanpela ples, orait yupela i mas painimaut gut, wanem man bilong dispela ples em i gutpela na stretpela man. Na yupela i mas i stap wantaim dispela man inap long taim yupela i lusim dispela ples.

ReferenceBlocks.text: As you enter into the household, greet it.

block.text: Sapos yupela i go insait long wanpela haus, orait yupela i mas tokim ol manmeri bilong haus olsem, 'God i ken mekim gut long yupela.'

ReferenceBlocks.text: If the household is worthy, let your peace come on it, but if it isn’t worthy, let your peace return to you.

block.text: Na sapos ol manmeri bilong dispela haus i amamas long kisim yupela, orait gutpela tok bilong yupela i ken i stap long ol. Tasol sapos ol i no amamas long kisim yupela, orait yupela i ken kisim bek gutpela tok bilong yupela.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Whoever doesn’t receive you, nor hear your words, as you go out of that house or that city, shake off the dust from your feet.

block.text: Sapos wanpela man i no laik kisim yupela i go long haus bilong en, na i no laik harim tok bilong yupela, orait taim yupela i lusim dispela haus o dispela taun yupela i mas rausim pipia graun i stap long lek bilong yupela.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Most certainly I tell you, it will be more tolerable for the land of Sodom and Gomorrah in the day of judgment than for that city.

block.text: Mi tok tru long yupela, long de God i makim bilong kotim ol manmeri, hevi i kamap long ol manmeri bilong dispela taun bai i winim tru hevi i kamap long ol lain bilong taun Sodom na Gomora."

ReferenceBlocks.text: Behold, I send you out as sheep in the midst of wolves. Therefore be wise as serpents, and harmless as doves.

block.text: Jisas i tok moa olsem, "Harim. Mi salim yupela i go olsem ol sipsip i go namel long ol weldok. Olsem na yupela i mas bihainim pasin bilong ol snek, na tingim gut pastaim ol samting yupela i laik mekim. Na yupela i mas bihainim pasin bilong ol dispela pisin ol i kolim balus, na yupela i no ken tingting long mekim wanpela pasin nogut.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But beware of men: for they will deliver you up to councils, and in their synagogues they will scourge you.

block.text: Yupela lukaut long ol man. Ol bai i kotim yupela long ol kaunsil bilong ol, na ol bai i wipim yupela insait long ol haus lotu bilong ol.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Yes, and you will be brought before governors and kings for my sake, for a testimony to them and to the nations.

block.text: Ol bai i ting long daunim mi, na pulim yupela i go long ol gavman na ol king. Olsem na bai yupela i ken autim gutnius long ol dispela bikman, na long ol arapela haiden tu.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But when they deliver you up, don’t be anxious how or what you will say, for it will be given you in that hour what you will say.

block.text: Taim ol i bringim yupela i go long kot, yupela i no ken pret na ting, 'Mipela bai i mekim wanem kain tok? Na mipela bai i bekim wanem tok?' Nogat. Long dispela taim stret God bai i soim yupela long tok yupela i mas autim.

ReferenceBlocks.text: For it is not you who speak, but the Spirit of your Father who speaks in you.

block.text: Long wanem, i no yupela yet bai i autim tok. Nogat. Spirit bilong Papa bilong yupela, em bai i autim tok long maus bilong yupela.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Brother will deliver up brother to death, and the father his child. Children will rise up against parents, and cause them to be put to death.

block.text: "Man bai i kotim brata bilong en, na tokim ol long kilim dispela brata i dai. Na ol papa bai i mekim wankain pasin long ol pikinini bilong ol. Na ol pikinini bai i birua long papamama bilong ol na tokim ol man long kilim ol i dai.

ReferenceBlocks.text: You will be hated by all men for my name’s sake, but he who endures to the end will be saved.

block.text: Na olgeta man bai i bel nogut tru long yupela, long wanem, nem bilong mi em i stap long yupela. Tasol ol manmeri i stap strong inap long las de, God bai i kisim bek ol.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But when they persecute you in this city, flee into the next, for most certainly I tell you, you will not have gone through all the cities of Israel until the Son of Man has come.

block.text: Na sapos ol manmeri bilong wanpela taun i mekim nogut long yupela, orait yupela i mas ranawe i go long narapela taun. Mi tok tru long yupela, yupela bai i no pinisim wok yet long olgeta taun bilong Israel, na Pikinini Bilong Man bai i kam.

ReferenceBlocks.text: A disciple is not above his teacher, nor a servant above his lord.

block.text: "Sumatin i no winim tisa bilong en, na wokboi i no stap antap long bikman bilong en.

ReferenceBlocks.text: It is enough for the disciple that he be like his teacher, and the servant like his lord. If they have called the master of the house Beelzebul, how much more those of his household!

block.text: Sapos sumatin i kamap wankain olsem tisa bilong en, em inap. Na sapos wokboi i kamap wankain olsem bikman bilong en, em tu inap. Ol i bin givim nem Belsebul long papa bilong haus, olsem na yumi save, ol bai i givim ol nem i nogut moa yet long ol lain bilong en."

ReferenceBlocks.text: Therefore don’t be afraid of them, for there is nothing covered that will not be revealed; and hidden that will not be known.

block.text: Jisas i tok moa olsem, "Yupela i no ken pret long ol man i laik mekim nogut long yupela. Olgeta samting i karamap i stap bai i kamap long ples klia. Na olgeta tok hait bai ol man i save long en.

ReferenceBlocks.text: What I tell you in the darkness, speak in the light; and what you hear whispered in the ear, proclaim on the housetops.

block.text: Tok mi mekim long yupela long tudak, em yupela i mas autim long san. Na tok yupela i harim isi tasol long yau, em yupela i mas sanap antap long haus na autim long ol manmeri.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Don’t be afraid of those who kill the body, but are not able to kill the soul. Rather, fear the one who is able to destroy both soul and body in Gehenna.

block.text: Yupela i no ken pret long ol man i save kilim i dai bodi, tasol ol i no inap kilim spirit bilong yupela. Nogat. Yupela i mas pret long God tasol. Em inap bagarapim spirit na bodi tu long hel.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Aren’t two sparrows sold for a penny? Not one of them falls on the ground apart from your Father’s will.

block.text: "Yupela i save, ol man i save baim tupela liklik pisin long 10 toea tasol. Na Papa bilong yupela i save lukautim gut ol dispela pisin. Sapos em i no laik, orait i no inap wanpela bilong ol i pundaun long graun.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Even the very hairs of your head are all numbered.

block.text: Na tu, God i kaunim pinis olgeta gras long het bilong yupela, na em i save gut tru long yupela.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Therefore don’t be afraid. You are of more value than many sparrows.

block.text: Olsem na yupela i no ken pret. Yupela i winim planti lain liklik pisin."

ReferenceBlocks.text: Everyone therefore who confesses me before men, him I will also confess before my Father who is in heaven.

block.text: Jisas i tok moa olsem, "Man i save tokim ol manmeri olsem em i stap long lain bilong mi, mi tu bai mi tokim Papa bilong mi long heven olsem dispela man em i bilong mi.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But whoever denies me before men, him I will also deny before my Father who is in heaven.

block.text: Tasol man i tokim ol manmeri olsem em i no man bilong lain bilong mi, mi tu bai mi tokim Papa bilong mi long heven olsem dispela man em i no bilong mi."

ReferenceBlocks.text: Don’t think that I came to send peace on the earth. I didn’t come to send peace, but a sword.

block.text: Jisas i tok moa olsem, "Yupela i no ken ting mi kam bilong mekim i dai olgeta pait long graun. Mi no kam bilong mekim i dai pait. Nogat. Mi bringim bainat i kam.

ReferenceBlocks.text: For I came to set a man at odds against his father, and a daughter against her mother, and a daughter-in-law against her mother-in-law.

block.text: Mi kam bilong mekim pasin birua i kamap. Man bai i birua long papa bilong en, na pikinini meri bai i birua long mama bilong en, na maritmeri bai i birua long mama bilong man bilong en.

ReferenceBlocks.text: A man’s foes will be those of his own household.

block.text: Ol famili bilong man yet bai i kamap birua bilong en.

ReferenceBlocks.text: He who loves father or mother more than me is not worthy of me; and he who loves son or daughter more than me isn’t worthy of me.

block.text: "Man i laikim tumas papa o mama bilong en, na i no laikim mi moa yet, em i no inap i stap pren bilong mi. Na man i laikim tumas pikinini man o pikinini meri bilong en, na em i no laikim mi moa yet, em i no inap i stap pren bilong mi.

ReferenceBlocks.text: He who doesn’t take his cross and follow after me, isn’t worthy of me.

block.text: Na man i no karim diwai kros bilong en na bihainim mi, em i no inap i stap pren bilong mi.

ReferenceBlocks.text: He who seeks his life will lose it; and he who loses his life for my sake will find it.

block.text: Man i ting em i mekim laip bilong em yet i kamap gutpela, laip bilong en bai i lus. Tasol man i ting long mi na i lusim laip bilong en, em bai i kisim laip tru."

ReferenceBlocks.text: He who receives you receives me, and he who receives me receives him who sent me.

block.text: Jisas i tok moa olsem, "Man i kisim yupela na i mekim long yupela, em i kisim mi na i mekim gut long mi. Na man i kisim mi, em i kisim God, em i bin salim mi na mi kam.

ReferenceBlocks.text: He who receives a prophet in the name of a prophet will receive a prophet’s reward. He who receives a righteous man in the name of a righteous man will receive a righteous man’s reward.

block.text: Sapos wanpela man i ting, 'Mi laik helpim profet,' na em i kisim wanpela profet i kam long haus na i lukautim em, orait God bai i givim dispela man ol wankain gutpela samting olsem ol profet i save kisim. Na man i ting, 'Mi laik helpim stretpela man,' na i kisim wanpela stretpela man i kam long haus na i lukautim em, dispela man bai i kisim ol wankain gutpela samting olsem ol stretpela man i save kisim.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Whoever gives one of these little ones just a cup of cold water to drink in the name of a disciple, most certainly I tell you he will in no way lose his reward.”

block.text: Na man i ting, 'Mi laik helpim disaipel bilong Jisas,' na em i givim kap kol wara tasol long wanpela bilong ol dispela manmeri nating i stap long lain disaipel bilong mi, orait mi tok tru long yupela, pe bilong dispela man bai i no inap lus."

ReferenceBlocks.text: MATTHEW 11
It happened that when Jesus had finished directing his twelve disciples, he departed from there to teach and preach in their cities.

block.text: Jisas i autim pinis dispela tok em i givim bilong skulim ol 12 -pela disaipel bilong en, orait em i lusim dispela ples na i go long ol taun bilong dispela hap na i skulim ol manmeri na i autim tok bilong God long ol.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Now when John heard in the prison what Christ was doing, he sent two of his disciples
and said to him,

block.text: Jon i stap long kalabus, na taim em i harim tok long olgeta wok Krais i mekim, em i salim ol disaipel bilong en i go long Jisas. Em i tokim ol disaipel
long askim Jisas olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Are you the one who comes, or should we look for another?”

block.text: "Ating yu dispela man God i bin promis long salim i kam, o mipela i mas wetim narapela?"

ReferenceBlocks.text: Jesus answered them,

block.text: Orait Jisas i bekim tok bilong ol olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Go and tell John the things which you hear and see:

block.text: "Yupela go tokim Jon long olgeta samting yupela i harim na lukim.

ReferenceBlocks.text: the blind receive their sight, the lame walk, the lepers are cleansed, the deaf hear, the dead are raised up, and the poor have good news preached to them.

block.text: Ol aipas ol i lukluk gen, na ol lek nogut ol i wokabaut. Skin bilong ol man i gat sik lepra, em i kamap klin, na ol yaupas i harim toktok. Ol man i dai pinis, ol i kirap gen, na ol rabisman i harim gutnius.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Blessed is he who finds no occasion for stumbling in me.”

block.text: Na ol man i lukim mi na bilip bilong ol i no pundaun, ol i ken amamas."

ReferenceBlocks.text: As these went their way, Jesus began to say to the multitudes concerning John,

block.text: Ol disaipel bilong Jon i go pinis, orait Jisas i tokim ol manmeri long Jon olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “What did you go out into the wilderness to see? A reed shaken by the wind?

block.text: "Taim yupela i bin i go long hap i no gat man, yupela i go bilong lukim wanem samting? Ating yupela i go bilong lukim win i sakim wanpela pitpit? Nogat.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But what did you go out to see? A man in soft clothing? Behold, those who wear soft clothing are in king’s houses.

block.text: Yupela i go bilong lukim wanem samting? Ating yupela i go bilong lukim wanpela man i putim ol gutpela gutpela klos? Nogat. Ol man i putim ol gutpela gutpela klos, ol i save stap long haus bilong ol king.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But why did you go out? To see a prophet? Yes, I tell you, and much more than a prophet.

block.text: Tasol bilong wanem yupela i go? Bilong lukim wanpela profet, a? Em tasol. Na mi tokim yupela, dispela profet hia em i winim olgeta arapela profet.

ReferenceBlocks.text: For this is the one of whom it is written, ‘Behold, I send my messenger before your face, who will prepare your way before you.’

block.text: Long dispela man tasol buk bilong God i tok olsem, 'Harim. Bai mi salim wanpela man bilong autim tok bilong mi, na em bai i go paslain long yu. Na em bai i redim rot bilong yu.'

ReferenceBlocks.text: Most certainly I tell you, among those who are born of women there has not arisen anyone greater than John the Baptizer; yet he who is least in the Kingdom of Heaven is greater than he.

block.text: Mi tok tru long yupela, Jon Bilong Baptais em i winim olgeta man i bin kamap long graun. Tasol man i stap liklik tru long kingdom bilong heven, em i winim Jon.

ReferenceBlocks.text: From the days of John the Baptizer until now, the Kingdom of Heaven suffers violence, and the violent take it by force.

block.text: "Stat long taim Jon Bilong Baptais i autim tok na i kam inap nau, ol strongpela man bilong pait i bin wok strong long kisim kingdom bilong heven, na ol i bin mekim olkain pasin bilong pait na givim planti hevi long en.

ReferenceBlocks.text: For all the prophets and the law prophesied until John.

block.text: Olgeta profet, na buk bilong lo tu, ol i bin autim tok bilong God inap long taim Jon i kamap.

ReferenceBlocks.text: If you are willing to receive it, this is Elijah, who is to come.

block.text: Na sapos yupela i laik harim, orait harim. Buk bilong God i tok olsem profet Elaija i mas i kam, em i tok long Jon tasol.

ReferenceBlocks.text: He who has ears to hear, let him hear.”

block.text: Man i gat yau em i mas harim dispela tok.

ReferenceBlocks.text: “But to what shall I compare this generation? It is like children sitting in the marketplaces, who call to their companions and say,

block.text: "Sapos mi laik tokaut long pasin bilong ol manmeri bilong dispela taim, bai mi mekim wanem kain tok piksa? Ol i olsem ol pikinini i sindaun i stap long ol ples bung na i singaut long ol arapela pikinini olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: ‘We played the flute for you, and you didn’t dance. We mourned for you, and you didn’t lament.’

block.text: 'Mipela i winim mambu bilong yupela i ken singsing, tasol yupela i no laik singsing. Na mipela i mekim singsing sori, tasol yupela i no laik sori na krai.'"

ReferenceBlocks.text: For John came neither eating nor drinking, and they say, ‘He has a demon.’

block.text: Na Jisas i tok moa olsem, "Jon i kam, na em i no save kaikai planti na em i no save dring wain. Na ol i tok, 'Spirit nogut i stap long en.'

ReferenceBlocks.text: The Son of Man came eating and drinking, and they say, ‘Behold, a gluttonous man and a drunkard, a friend of tax collectors and sinners!’ But wisdom is justified by her children.”

block.text: Na Pikinini Bilong Man i kam, na em i kaikai na i dring, na ol i tok, 'Lukim, em i man bilong kaikai planti tumas, na em i man bilong dring planti wain tumas. Em i pren bilong ol man bilong kisim takis na bilong ol man bilong mekim sin.' Ol i save tok olsem, tasol ol wok bilong God i soim olsem save bilong en em i samting tru."

ReferenceBlocks.text: Then he began to denounce the cities in which most of his mighty works had been done, because they didn’t repent.

block.text: Long sampela taun Jisas i wokim planti mirakel, tasol ol I no tanim bel. Olsem na long dispela taim Jisas i krosim ol manmeri bilong ol dispela taun.

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Woe to you, Chorazin! Woe to you, Bethsaida! For if the mighty works had been done in Tyre and Sidon which were done in you, they would have repented long ago in sackcloth and ashes.

block.text: Em i tok olsem, "Sori tumas, yupela ol manmeri bilong taun Korasin. Sori tumas, yupela ol Betsaida. Sapos wanpela man i bin i go long taun Tair na Saidon na wokim ol mirakel olsem mi bin wokim namel long yupela, orait longtaim ol Tair na Saidon ol inap tanim bel na pasim ol klos bilong sori na sindaun long sit bilong paia, bilong soim ol i sori tru long ol sin ol i bin mekim.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But I tell you, it will be more tolerable for Tyre and Sidon on the day of judgment than for you.

block.text: Olsem na mi tokim yupela, long de God i makim bilong kotim ol manmeri, hevi i kamap long yupela bai i winim tru hevi i kamap long ol Tair na Saidon.

ReferenceBlocks.text: You, Capernaum, who are exalted to heaven, you will go down to Hades. For if the mighty works had been done in Sodom which were done in you, it would have remained until this day.

block.text: Na yupela ol Kaperneam, ating ol bai i litimapim yupela i go antap tru long heven, a? Nogat tru. Yupela bai i go daunbilo tru long ples bilong ol man i dai pinis. Sapos wanpela man i bin i go long taun Sodom na wokim ol mirakel olsem mi bin wokim namel long yupela, orait Sodom bai i stap yet.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But I tell you that it will be more tolerable for the land of Sodom, on the day of judgment, than for you.”

block.text: Olsem na mi tokim yupela, long de God i makim bilong kotim ol manmeri, hevi i kamap long yupela bai i winim tru hevi i kamap long ol Sodom."

ReferenceBlocks.text: At that time, Jesus declared,

block.text: Long dispela taim Jisas i tok olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “I thank you, Father, Lord of heaven and earth, that you hid these things from the wise and understanding, and revealed them to infants.

block.text: "Papa, yu Bikpela bilong heven na bilong graun, mi tenkyu long yu, long wanem, yu bin haitim ol dispela samting long ol man i gat gutpela tingting na save, na yu bin soim long ol man i stap olsem ol liklik pikinini tasol.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Yes, Father, for it was pleasing in your sight.

block.text: Yes, Papa, yu bin bihainim laik bilong yu tasol na mekim olsem."

ReferenceBlocks.text: All things have been delivered to me by my Father. No one knows the Son, except the Father; neither does anyone know the Father, except the Son, and he to whom the Son desires to reveal him.”

block.text: Na Jisas i tok moa olsem, "Papa bilong mi em i putim pinis olgeta samting long han bilong mi. Na i no gat wanpela man i save long Pikinini. Papa wanpela tasol em i save. Na i no gat wanpela man i save long Papa. Pikinini tasol wantaim ol man Pikinini yet i soim Papa long ol, ol tasol i save long Papa.

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Come to me, all you who labor and are heavily burdened, and I will give you rest.

block.text: "Yupela ol man i save hatwok tru na i karim ol bikpela hevi, yupela olgeta kam long mi na bai mi givim malolo long yupela.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Take my yoke upon you, and learn from me, for I am gentle and lowly in heart; and you will find rest for your souls.

block.text: Yupela kisim save long mi na aninit long tok bilong mi, olsem yupela i kisim plang ol i save putim long nek bilong ol bulmakau bilong ol i ken pulim ol samting. Yupela kisim save long mi, long wanem, mi save mekim pasin isi long ol man na mi save daunim mi yet. Na bai ol samting i no ken givim hevi long yupela na bai yupela i kisim malolo.

ReferenceBlocks.text: For my yoke is easy, and my burden is light.”

block.text: Dispela plang mi putim long nek bilong yupela, em i isi long karim, na samting mi givim yupela bilong karim, em i no hevi."

ReferenceBlocks.text: MATTHEW 12
At that time, Jesus went on the Sabbath day through the grain fields. His disciples were hungry and began to pluck heads of grain and to eat.

block.text: Bihain, long wanpela de Sabat Jisas i wokabaut namel long ol gaden wit. Na ol disaipel bilong en i hangre, na ol i wok long kisim ol pikinini bilong wit, na ol i kaikai.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But the Pharisees, when they saw it, said to him,

block.text: Ol Farisi i lukim, na ol I tokim Jisas olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Behold, your disciples do what is not lawful to do on the Sabbath.”

block.text: "Lukim, dispela pasin ol disaipel bilong yu i mekim, em i tambu long mekim long de Sabat."

ReferenceBlocks.text: But he said to them,

block.text: Na Jisas i bekim tok bilong ol olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Haven’t you read what David did, when he was hungry, and those who were with him;

block.text: "Ating yupela i no bin ritim dispela stori long samting Devit i bin mekim bipo? Mi tok long dispela taim em wantaim ol lain bilong en ol i stap hangre

ReferenceBlocks.text: how he entered into God’s house, and ate the show bread, which was not lawful for him to eat, neither for those who were with him, but only for the priests?

block.text: na Devit i go insait long haus bilong God na kisim dispela bret ol i save putim i stap long pes bilong God, na em wantaim ol lain bilong en i kaikai. Dispela bret em i tambu long ol. Ol pris tasol inap long kaikai.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Or have you not read in the law, that on the Sabbath day, the priests in the temple profane the Sabbath, and are guiltless?

block.text: Na ating yupela i no bin ritim tu dispela tok i stap long buk bilong lo, em i tok long ol pris i save mekim wok long tempel ol i mas mekim wok long de Sabat? Ol i save kalapim lo bilong de Sabat, tasol ol i no gat asua.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But I tell you that one greater than the temple is here.

block.text: Orait mi tokim yupela, samting i stap hia, em i winim tempel.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But if you had known what this means, ‘I desire mercy, and not sacrifice,’ you would not have condemned the guiltless.

block.text: Tasol sapos yupela i bin save gut long as bilong dispela tok i stap long buk bilong God, 'Mi no laikim ol ofa nating yupela i save mekim. Mi laikim tumas bai yupela i mekim gutpela pasin long ol arapela,' orait bai yupela i no inap putim hevi long ol man i no gat asua.

ReferenceBlocks.text: For the Son of Man is Lord of the Sabbath.”

block.text: Long wanem, Pikinini Bilong Man em i bosim de Sabat."

ReferenceBlocks.text: He departed there, and went into their synagogue.

block.text: Jisas i lusim dispela hap na em i go kamap long wanpela taun na em i go insait long haus lotu bilong ol.

ReferenceBlocks.text: And behold there was a man with a withered hand. In order to accuse Jesus, they asked him,

block.text: Na wanpela man I stap, wanpela han bilong en i dai pinis. Sampela man i laik kotim Jisas, olsem na ol i askim em,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Is it lawful to heal on the Sabbath day?”

block.text: "Ating yumi ken mekim orait ol sikman long de Sabat, o nogat?"

ReferenceBlocks.text: He said to them,

block.text: Na Jisas i tokim ol olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “What man is there among you, who has one sheep, and if this one falls into a pit on the Sabbath day, won’t he grab on to it, and lift it out?

block.text: "Sapos wanpela man namel long yupela em i gat wanpela sipsip, na dispela sipsip i pundaun long wanpela hul long de Sabat, orait yupela i save, dispela man bai i holim sipsip na pulim i kam antap.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Of how much more value then is a man than a sheep! Therefore it is lawful to do good on the Sabbath day.”

block.text: Tasol man em i winim tru sipsip. Olsem na em i orait long yumi mekim gutpela pasin long de Sabat."

ReferenceBlocks.text: Then he told the man,

block.text: Na em i tokim dispela man olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Stretch out your hand.”

block.text: "Stretim han bilong yu."

ReferenceBlocks.text: He stretched it out; and it was restored whole, just like the other.

block.text: Na man i stretim han, na han i kamap gutpela gen, olsem arapela han.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But the Pharisees went out, and conspired against him, how they might destroy him.

block.text: Tasol ol Farisi i kirap na lusim haus na i go bung na wokim toktok bilong painim rot long kilim Jisas i dai.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Jesus, perceiving that, withdrew from there. Great multitudes followed him; and he healed them all,
and commanded them, saying:

block.text: Jisas i save long samting ol Farisi i laik mekim long em, olsem na em i lusim dispela taun na i go. Na planti manmeri i bihainim em, na em i mekim orait olgeta manmeri i gat sik.
Na Jisas i tambuim ol long

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Do not make my presence known.”

block.text: ol i no ken autim tok bilong em long ol arapela manmeri.

ReferenceBlocks.text: that it might be fulfilled which was spoken through Isaiah the prophet, saying,

block.text: Long dispela pasin, Jisas inapim wanpela tok God i bin mekim long maus bilong profet Aisaia. Em i bin tok olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Behold, my servant whom I have chosen; my beloved in whom my soul is well pleased: I will put my Spirit on him. He will proclaim justice to the nations.

block.text: "Dispela em i wokman bilong mi. Mi yet mi bin makim em. Mi laikim em tumas, na bel bilong mi em i amamas moa yet long em. Bai mi putim Spirit bilong mi long em, na em bai i autim tok bilong stretpela pasin long olgeta lain manmeri bilong graun.

ReferenceBlocks.text: He will not strive, nor shout; neither will anyone hear his voice in the streets.

block.text: Em bai i no mekim tok kros na singaut bikmaus. Ol manmeri bai i no harim em i toktok long ol rot.

ReferenceBlocks.text: He won’t break a bruised reed. He won’t quench a smoking flax, until he leads justice to victory.

block.text: Pitpit i no gat strong na i laik bruk, em bai i no brukim olgeta. Na em bai i no mekim i dai lam i no lait gut. Em bai i wok i stap, inap em i mekim stretpela pasin i win tru.

ReferenceBlocks.text: In his name, the nations will hope.”

block.text: Na ol manmeri bilong ol arapela lain bai ol i bilip long em na wetim em i helpim ol."

ReferenceBlocks.text: Then one possessed by a demon, blind and mute, was brought to him and he healed him, so that the blind and mute man both spoke and saw.

block.text: Long dispela taim ol i kisim wanpela man i gat spirit nogut i stap long em na bringim em i kam long Jisas. Dispela man i aipas na mauspas. Na Jisas i mekim em i orait, na dispela mauspas i toktok na i lukluk.

ReferenceBlocks.text: All the multitudes were amazed, and said,

block.text: Na olgeta manmeri i kirap nogut na i tok,

block.characterId: people who saw healing of demon-possessed man who was blind and mute

ReferenceBlocks.characterId: people who saw healing of demon-possessed man who was blind and mute
ReferenceBlocks.text: “Can this be the son of David?”

block.text: "Ating dispela man em i Pikinini Bilong Devit, a?"

ReferenceBlocks.text: But when the Pharisees heard it, they said,

block.text: Tasol ol Farisi I harim dispela tok, na ol i tok olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “This man does not cast out demons, except by Beelzebul, the prince of the demons.”

block.text: "Dispela man i save rausim ol spirit nogut long strong bilong Belsebul tasol, em hetman bilong ol spirit nogut."

ReferenceBlocks.text: Knowing their thoughts, Jesus said to them,

block.text: Tasol Jisas i save long tingting bilong ol, na em i tokim ol olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Every kingdom divided against itself is brought to desolation, and every city or house divided against itself will not stand.

block.text: "Sapos ol man bilong wanpela kantri i bruk tupela lain na ol i pait, orait dispela kantri bai i bagarap. Na sapos ol man bilong wanpela taun o wanpela haus ol i bruk tupela lain na ol i pait, dispela taun o haus bai i no inap i stap strong.

ReferenceBlocks.text: If Satan casts out Satan, he is divided against himself. How then will his kingdom stand?

block.text: Olsem tasol, sapos Satan i rausim Satan, yumi save lain bilong en i bruk pinis. Olsem wanem bai em i gat strong bilong bosim ol samting?

ReferenceBlocks.text: If I by Beelzebul cast out demons, by whom do your children cast them out? Therefore they will be your judges.

block.text: Na sapos em i tru Belsebul i save helpim mi na mi rausim ol spirit nogut, orait husat i save helpim ol lain bilong yupela, na ol i rausim ol spirit nogut? Ol lain bilong yupela yet bai i soim yupela olsem dispela tok bilong yupela em i no stret.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But if I by the Spirit of God cast out demons, then the Kingdom of God has come upon you.

block.text: Tasol sapos Spirit bilong God i helpim mi na mi rausim ol spirit nogut, orait yupela i ken save, kingdom bilong God i kam pinis long yupela.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Or how can one enter into the house of the strong man, and plunder his goods, unless he first bind the strong man? Then he will plunder his house.”

block.text: "Olsem wanem na wanpela man em inap i go insait long haus bilong wanpela strongpela man na kisim ol samting bilong en? Em i mas pasim dispela strongpela man long baklain pastaim. Sapos em i mekim olsem, orait nau bai em inap kisim ol samting i stap long haus bilong dispela man.

ReferenceBlocks.text: “He who is not with me is against me, and he who doesn’t gather with me, scatters.

block.text: "Man i no pren bilong mi, em i save birua long mi. Na man i no helpim mi long bungim ol manmeri, em i save ranim ol i go nabaut.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Therefore I tell you, every sin and blasphemy will be forgiven men, but the blasphemy against the Spirit will not be forgiven men.

block.text: "Olsem na mi tokim yupela, God bai i lusim olgeta sin na olgeta tok nogut ol manmeri i mekim. Tasol man i mekim tok nogut long Holi Spirit, God bai i no inap lusim sin bilong dispela man.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Whoever speaks a word against the Son of Man, it will be forgiven him; but whoever speaks against the Holy Spirit, it will not be forgiven him, neither in this age, nor in that which is to come.”

block.text: Man i mekim tok nogut long Pikinini Bilong Man, God bai i lusim dispela sin bilong em. Tasol man i mekim tok nogut long Holi Spirit, God bai i no lusim dispela sin bilong em nau na long taim bihain tu."

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Either make the tree good, and its fruit good, or make the tree corrupt, and its fruit corrupt; for the tree is known by its fruit.

block.text: Jisas i tok moa olsem, "Sapos diwai i gutpela, orait kaikai bilong en tu bai i gutpela. Na sapos diwai i nogut, orait kaikai bilong en tu bai i nogut. Ol man i save lukim kaikai pastaim, na ol i save, diwai em i gutpela o em i nogut.

ReferenceBlocks.text: You offspring of vipers, how can you, being evil, speak good things? For out of the abundance of the heart, the mouth speaks.

block.text: Yupela man nogut, yupela i olsem ol snek nogut. Olsem wanem na yupela inap mekim gutpela tok? Man em i save autim kain tingting i pulap long bel bilong en.

ReferenceBlocks.text: The good man out of his good treasure of the heart brings out good things, and the evil man out of his evil treasure brings out evil things.

block.text: Gutpela man i gat planti gutpela tingting i stap long bel bilong en. Olsem na em i save mekim gutpela pasin. Man nogut em i gat planti tingting nogut i stap long bel bilong en. Olsem na em i save mekim pasin nogut.

ReferenceBlocks.text: I tell you that every idle word that men speak, they will give account of it in the day of judgment.

block.text: "Tasol mi tokim yupela, long de God i makim bilong kotim ol manmeri, em bai i tingting long olgeta toktok nabaut ol manmeri i bin mekim na em bai i skelim ol.

ReferenceBlocks.text: For by your words you will be justified, and by your words you will be condemned.”

block.text: Long tok bilong yu yet God bai i kolim yu stretpela man. Na long tok bilong yu yet em bai i kolim yu man nogut."

ReferenceBlocks.text: Then certain of the scribes and Pharisees answered,

block.text: Orait sampela saveman bilong lo na sampela Farisi i tokim Jisas olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Teacher, we want to see a sign from you.”

block.text: "Tisa, mipela i laik bai yu wokim wanpela mirakel olsem mak bilong soim mipela olsem yu mekim wok bilong God."

ReferenceBlocks.text: But he answered them,

block.text: Tasol em i bekim tok bilong ol olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “An evil and adulterous generation seeks after a sign, but no sign will be given it but the sign of Jonah the prophet.

block.text: "Ol manmeri bilong dispela taim ol i lain manmeri nogut na ol i no save bel tru long God. Oltaim ol i save singaut long lukim mak. Tasol ol bai i no inap lukim wanpela mak. Nogat. Wanpela mak tasol bai ol i lukim, em mak bilong profet Jona.

ReferenceBlocks.text: For as Jonah was three days and three nights in the belly of the whale, so will the Son of Man be three days and three nights in the heart of the earth.

block.text: Jona i bin i stap tripela san na tripela nait insait long bel bilong bikpela pis, na olsem tasol Pikinini Bilong Man bai i stap tripela san na tripela nait insait long graun.

ReferenceBlocks.text: The men of Nineveh will stand up in the judgment with this generation, and will condemn it, for they repented at the preaching of Jonah; and behold, someone greater than Jonah is here.

block.text: Long de God i makim bilong kotim ol manmeri, ol man bilong Ninive bai i sanap long kot na tokaut long pasin nogut bilong ol manmeri bilong dispela taim nau. Long wanem, ol Ninive i bin harim tok Jona i autim, na ol i tanim bel. Tasol i gat wanpela man i stap namel long yupela, em i winim tru Jona.

ReferenceBlocks.text: The queen of the south will rise up in the judgment with this generation, and will condemn it, for she came from the ends of the earth to hear the wisdom of Solomon; and behold, one greater than Solomon is here.

block.text: Taim God i kotim ol manmeri, kwin bilong hap bilong saut bai i sanap long kot na tokaut long pasin nogut bilong ol manmeri bilong dispela taim nau. Long wanem, dispela kwin i bin i stap long arere tru bilong graun, tasol em i kam bilong harim Solomon i autim gutpela save bilong em. Tasol i gat wanpela man i stap hia, em i winim tru Solomon."

ReferenceBlocks.text: But the unclean spirit, when he is gone out of the man, passes through waterless places, seeking rest, and doesn’t find it.

block.text: Jisas i tok moa olsem, "Sapos spirit nogut i lusim pinis wanpela man, orait spirit i save go nabaut long ples drai, bilong painim wanpela hap em i ken malolo long en. Tasol em bai i no lukim wanpela gutpela hap,

ReferenceBlocks.text: Then he says, ‘I will return into my house from which I came out,’ and when he has come back, he finds it empty, swept, and put in order.

block.text: na em bai i tok olsem, 'Bai mi go bek long dispela haus bipo mi stap long en.' Na em bai i go na lukim dispela haus i stap nating, na ol i brumim na bilasim pinis.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Then he goes, and takes with himself seven other spirits more evil than he is, and they enter in and dwell there. The last state of that man becomes worse than the first. Even so will it be also to this evil generation.”

block.text: Olsem na em bai i go kisim 7 -pela arapela spirit ol i winim em long mekim pasin nogut. Na ol bai i go insait na stap long dispela haus. Pastaim dispela man i stap nogut, tasol nau em bai i stap nogut moa yet. Wankain pasin tasol bai i kamap long ol manmeri nogut bilong dispela taim."

ReferenceBlocks.text: While he was yet speaking to the multitudes, behold, his mother and his brothers stood outside, seeking to speak to him.
One said to him,

block.text: Jisas i givim toktok yet long ol manmeri, na mama wantaim ol brata bilong en ol i kam sanap ausait. Ol i laik toktok wantaim em.
Na wanpela man i tokim em,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Behold, your mother and your brothers stand outside, seeking to speak to you.”

block.text: "Harim. Mama bilong yu wantaim ol brata bilong yu ol i sanap ausait, na ol i laik toktok wantaim yu."

ReferenceBlocks.text: But he answered him who spoke to him,

block.text: Tasol Jisas i bekim tok bilong dispela man olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Who is my mother? Who are my brothers?”

block.text: "Husat em i mama bilong mi? Na husat em i brata bilong mi?"

ReferenceBlocks.text: He stretched out his hand towards his disciples, and said,

block.text: Na em i makim ol disaipel bilong en long han na i tok,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Behold, my mother and my brothers!

block.text: "Lukim mama bilong mi wantaim ol brata bilong mi.

ReferenceBlocks.text: For whoever does the will of my Father who is in heaven, he is my brother, and sister, and mother.”

block.text: Long wanem, man o meri i save bihainim laik bilong Papa bilong mi i stap long heven, em i brata na susa na mama bilong mi."

ReferenceBlocks.text: MATTHEW 13
On that day Jesus went out of the house, and sat by the seaside.

block.text: Long dispela de yet Jisas i lusim haus na i go ausait. Na em i sindaun long arere bilong raunwara.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Great multitudes gathered to him, so that he entered into a boat, and sat, and all the multitude stood on the beach.

block.text: Na planti lain manmeri tru i kam long em. Olsem na em i kalap long bot na i sindaun, na olgeta manmeri i sanap i stap long nambis.

ReferenceBlocks.text: He spoke to them many things in parables, saying,

block.text: Na Jisas i mekim planti tok piksa long ol. Em i tok olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Behold, a farmer went out to sow.
As he sowed, some seeds fell by the roadside, and the birds came and devoured them.

block.text: "Harim. Wanpela man i tromoi pikinini wit long gaden.
Em i wok long tromoi i go, na sampela pikinini wit i pundaun long rot, na ol pisin i kam kaikai.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Others fell on rocky ground, where they didn’t have much soil, and immediately they sprang up, because they had no depth of earth.

block.text: Na sampela pikinini wit i pundaun long hap graun i gat ston, na i no gat planti graun long en. Graun i no daun tumas, olsem na ol dispela wit i kamap kwik.

ReferenceBlocks.text: When the sun had risen, they were scorched. Because they had no root, they withered away.

block.text: Tasol taim san i kam antap em i kukim dispela wit. Na wit i no gat rop, olsem na em i drai olgeta, na i dai.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Others fell among thorns. The thorns grew up and choked them.

block.text: Na sampela pikinini wit i pundaun namel long ol rop i gat nil. Na ol rop i gat nil i kamap na i karamapim wit.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Others fell on good soil, and yielded fruit: some one hundred times as much, some sixty, and some thirty.

block.text: Tasol sampela pikinini wit i pundaun long gutpela graun, na i karim kaikai. Sampela i karim 100, na sampela i karim 60, na sampela i karim 30 .

ReferenceBlocks.text: He who has ears to hear, let him hear.”

block.text: Man i gat yau em i mas harim dispela tok."

ReferenceBlocks.text: The disciples came, and said to him,

block.text: Bihain ol disaipel i kam long Jisas na askim em olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Why do you speak to them in parables?”

block.text: "Bilong wanem yu save mekim tok piksa long ol manmeri?"

ReferenceBlocks.text: He answered them,

block.text: Na Jisas i bekim tok olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “To you it is given to know the mysteries of the Kingdom of Heaven, but it is not given to them.

block.text: "God i larim yupela i save pinis long as bilong tok hait bilong kingdom bilong heven. Tasol em i no soim long ol dispela manmeri.

ReferenceBlocks.text: For whoever has, to him will be given, and he will have abundance, but whoever doesn’t have, from him will be taken away even that which he has.

block.text: Sapos wanpela man i gat sampela samting pinis, orait God bai i givim sampela moa long em, na bai em i gat planti. Tasol sapos man i no gat ol samting, orait God bai i tekewe ol liklik samting em i holim pinis.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Therefore I speak to them in parables, because seeing they don’t see, and hearing, they don’t hear, neither do they understand.

block.text: Long dispela as tasol mi save mekim tok piksa long ol. Ai bilong ol i lukluk, tasol ol i no lukim wanpela samting. Ol i putim yau, tasol ol i no harim tok na kisim save.

ReferenceBlocks.text: In them the prophecy of Isaiah is fulfilled, which says, ‘By hearing you will hear, and will in no way understand; Seeing you will see, and will in no way perceive:

block.text: Long dispela ol manmeri, wanpela tok bilong profet Aisaia em i kamap tru. Em i bin tok olsem, 'Bai yupela i harim tok planti taim, tasol bai yupela i no save long as bilong en. Bai yupela i lukluk planti taim, tasol bai yupela i no luksave long wanpela samting.

ReferenceBlocks.text: for this people’s heart has grown callous, their ears are dull of hearing, they have closed their eyes; or else perhaps they might perceive with their eyes, hear with their ears, understand with their heart, and should turn again; and I would heal them.’”

block.text: Bel bilong dispela lain manmeri i pas pinis, na yau bilong ol i les long harim toktok, na ol i pasim pinis ai bilong ol, nogut ai bilong ol i lukim wanpela samting, na yau bilong ol i harim tok, na bel bilong ol i save long as bilong tok, na ol i tanim bel na kam bek long mi na mi mekim ol i kamap orait gen.'

ReferenceBlocks.text: “But blessed are your eyes, for they see; and your ears, for they hear.

block.text: "Tasol yupela i ken amamas. Ai bilong yupela i save lukim ol samting. Na yau bilong yupela i save harim tok.

ReferenceBlocks.text: For most certainly I tell you that many prophets and righteous men desired to see the things which you see, and didn’t see them; and to hear the things which you hear, and didn’t hear them.”

block.text: Mi tok tru long yupela, bipo planti profet na planti stretpela man ol i gat bikpela laik long lukim ol samting nau yupela i lukim, tasol ol i no bin lukim. Na ol i gat bikpela laik long harim dispela ol tok yupela i save harim, tasol ol i no bin harim."

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Hear, then, the parable of the farmer.

block.text: Jisas i tok moa olsem, "Nau yupela harim as bilong tok piksa bilong man i tromoi pikinini wit long gaden.

ReferenceBlocks.text: When anyone hears the word of the Kingdom, and doesn’t understand it, the evil one comes, and snatches away that which has been sown in his heart. This is what was sown by the roadside.

block.text: Ol man i harim gutnius bilong kingdom bilong heven na i no save long as bilong en, ol i olsem dispela pikinini wit i pundaun long rot, na Satan i save kam long ol na kwiktaim em i rausim dispela tok God i bin planim long bel bilong ol.

ReferenceBlocks.text: What was sown on the rocky places, this is he who hears the word, and immediately with joy receives it;

block.text: Na ol pikinini wit i pundaun long graun i gat ston, em i olsem man i harim tok na i kisim kwiktaim na i amamas long en.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But since he has no root in himself, he only endures for a short time. When oppression or persecution arises because of the word, immediately he stumbles.

block.text: Tasol em i no gat rop bilong en, na em i save stap liklik taim tasol. Taim ol man i laik daunim tok bilong God ol i givim hevi long dispela man na mekim nogut long em, orait bilip bilong en i save bagarap kwiktaim.

ReferenceBlocks.text: What was sown among the thorns, this is he who hears the word, but the cares of this age and the deceitfulness of riches choke the word, and he becomes unfruitful.

block.text: Na ol pikinini wit i pundaun namel long ol rop i gat nil, em i olsem man i harim tok, tasol em i tingting planti long ol samting bilong graun, na em i wari long bungim planti mani. Ol dispela samting i karamapim tok bilong God, na em i no karim kaikai.

ReferenceBlocks.text: What was sown on the good ground, this is he who hears the word, and understands it, who most certainly bears fruit, and brings forth, some one hundred times as much, some sixty, and some thirty.”

block.text: Tasol ol dispela pikinini wit i pundaun long gutpela graun, em i olsem man i harim tok na i save gut as bilong en. Em i save karim kaikai, inap 100 o 60 o 30 ."

ReferenceBlocks.text: He set another parable before them, saying,

block.text: Jisas i givim narapela tok piksa long ol olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “The Kingdom of Heaven is like a man who sowed good seed in his field.

block.text: "Kingdom bilong heven em i olsem wanpela man i tromoi ol gutpela pikinini wit long gaden bilong en.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But while everyone was sleeping, his enemy came and sowed weeds among the wheat, and went away.

block.text: Tasol taim ol manmeri i slip, birua bilong dispela man i kam, na em i tromoi ol pikinini bilong gras nogut namel long wit, na em i go.

ReferenceBlocks.text: When the blade sprang up and brought forth fruit, the weeds appeared also.

block.text: Bihain dispela wit i kamap na i laik karim kaikai, na ol i lukim gras nogut i stap wantaim.

ReferenceBlocks.text: The servants of the householder came and said to him, ‘Sir, didn’t you sow good seed in your field? Where did these weeds come from?’”

block.text: Orait na ol wokboi i go long papa bilong gaden na ol i tokim em olsem, 'Bikman, mipela i ting yu bin tromoi ol gutpela pikinini wit tasol long gaden bilong yu. Olsem wanem na dispela gras nogut i kamap?'

ReferenceBlocks.text: “He said to them, ‘An enemy has done this.’ The servants asked him, ‘Do you want us to go and gather them up?’”

block.text: "Na em i tokim ol, 'Wanpela birua i bin mekim dispela pasin.' Na ol wokboi i askim em, 'Yu laik bai mipela i go kamautim na bungim dispela gras nogut?'

ReferenceBlocks.text: “But he said, ‘No, lest perhaps while you gather up the weeds, you root up the wheat with them.

block.text: Tasol em i tokim ol olsem, 'Nogat. Nogut yupela i wok long kamautim gras nogut na yupela i kamautim wit wantaim.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Let both grow together until the harvest, and in the harvest time I will tell the reapers, First, gather up the weeds, and bind them in bundles to burn them; but gather the wheat into my barn.’”

block.text: Mobeta yupela i larim tupela i kamap wantaim, inap long taim bilong kisim kaikai. Na long taim bilong kisim kaikai bai mi tokim ol man i mekim dispela wok olsem, "Yupela bungim gras nogut pastaim, na pasim long mekpas bilong kukim long paia. Tasol yupela bungim wit na putim i stap long haus kaikai bilong mi."'

ReferenceBlocks.text: He set another parable before them, saying,

block.text: Jisas i givim narapela tok piksa long ol olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “The Kingdom of Heaven is like a grain of mustard seed, which a man took, and sowed in his field;

block.text: "Kingdom bilong heven em i olsem pikinini bilong dispela kain sayor ol i kolim mastet. Wanpela man i kisim pikinini bilong mastet na i planim long gaden bilong en.

ReferenceBlocks.text: which indeed is smaller than all seeds. But when it is grown, it is greater than the herbs, and becomes a tree, so that the birds of the air come and lodge in its branches.”

block.text: Pikinini bilong mastet em i no olsem ol arapela pikinini kaikai. Nogat. Em i liklik tru. Tasol taim em i kamap bikpela, em i winim olgeta kain sayor long gaden. Em i kamap olsem diwai, na ol pisin i save kam wokim haus bilong ol long ol han bilong en."

ReferenceBlocks.text: He spoke another parable to them.

block.text: Jisas i autim narapela tok piksa long ol olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “The Kingdom of Heaven is like yeast, which a woman took, and hid in three measures of meal, until it was all leavened.”

block.text: "Kingdom bilong heven em i olsem yis. Wanpela meri i kisim dispela yis na i tanim wantaim bikpela dram plaua. Na bihain dispela plaua olgeta i solap."

ReferenceBlocks.text: Jesus spoke all these things in parables to the multitudes; He didn’t say anything to them without using a parable.

block.text: Dispela olgeta tok Jisas i mekim long ol manmeri em i mekim long ol tok piksa. Em i no autim klia wanpela tok long ol. Nogat. Em i autim long tok piksa tasol.

ReferenceBlocks.text: So was fulfilled that which was spoken through the prophet:

block.text: Na long dispela pasin em inapim dispela tok wanpela profet i bin autim bipo. Profet i bin tok olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “I will open my mouth in parables; I will utter things hidden from the foundation of the world.”

block.text: "Mi bai mekim ol tok piksa long yupela Mi bai stori long ol kain kain samting i stap hait long bipo tru, taim graun i kamap i kam inap nau."

ReferenceBlocks.text: Then Jesus sent the multitudes away, and went into the house. His disciples came to him, saying,

block.text: Jisas i lusim ol manmeri na i go insait long haus. Na ol disaipel bilong en ol i kam long em na i tok,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Explain to us the parable of the weeds of the field.”

block.text: "Inap yu tokim mipela long as bilong dispela tok piksa bilong gras nogut i kamap long gaden?"

ReferenceBlocks.text: He answered them,

block.text: Na Jisas i bekim tok olsem long ol,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “He who sows the good seed is the Son of Man.

block.text: "Man i tromoi gutpela pikinini wit, em i Pikinini Bilong Man.

ReferenceBlocks.text: The field is the world, and the good seed are the children of the Kingdom. The weeds are the children of the evil one.

block.text: Na gaden em i dispela graun. Na ol gutpela pikinini wit, em ol manmeri bilong kingdom bilong heven. Na gras nogut, em ol manmeri bilong Satan.

ReferenceBlocks.text: The enemy who sowed them is the devil. The harvest is the end of the age, and the reapers are angels.

block.text: Dispela birua i tromoi pikinini bilong gras nogut, em Satan. Taim bilong kisim kaikai, em las de bilong dispela graun. Ol wokman em ol ensel tasol.

ReferenceBlocks.text: As therefore the weeds are gathered up and burned with fire; so will it be at the end of this age.

block.text: Ol man i save bungim gras nogut na kukim long paia, olsem tasol bai ol i mekim long las de bilong dispela graun.

ReferenceBlocks.text: The Son of Man will send out his angels, and they will weed out of his Kingdom all things that cause stumbling, and those who do iniquity.

block.text: Pikinini Bilong Man bai i salim ol ensel bilong en, na ol bai i rausim long kingdom bilong heven olgeta samting i save bagarapim bilip bilong man, wantaim olgeta man i save mekim pasin nogut.

ReferenceBlocks.text: They will cast them into the furnace of fire where there will be weeping and gnashing of teeth.

block.text: Na ol bai i tromoi ol i go long bikpela paia. Long dispela paia ol bai i krai nogut na skrapim tit bilong ol.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Then the righteous will shine forth like the sun in the Kingdom of their Father. He who has ears to hear, let him hear.”

block.text: Long dispela taim ol stretpela manmeri bai i lait olsem san, insait long kingdom bilong Papa bilong ol. Man i gat yau em i mas harim dispela tok."

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Again, the Kingdom of Heaven is like a treasure hidden in the field, which a man found, and hid. In his joy, he goes and sells all that he has, and buys that field.”

block.text: Jisas i tok moa olsem, "Kingdom bilong heven em i olsem wanpela bokis mani ol i bin haitim long wanpela gaden. Wanpela man i lukim, na em i haitim gen. Em i amamas tru, na em i go salim olgeta samting bilong en na i go baim dispela gaden."

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Again, the Kingdom of Heaven is like a man who is a merchant seeking fine pearls.

block.text: Jisas i tok moa olsem, "Orait narapela tok piksa i olsem. Kingdom bilong heven em i olsem wanpela bisnisman i wok long painim ol naispela naispela bis.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Having found one pearl of great price, he went and sold all that he had, and bought it.”

block.text: Na taim em i lukim wanpela bis i gutpela tru, orait em i go salim olgeta samting bilong en na i go baim dispela gutpela bis."

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Again, the Kingdom of Heaven is like a dragnet, that was cast into the sea, and gathered some fish of every kind.

block.text: Jisas i tok moa olsem, "Narapela tok piksa i olsem. Kingdom bilong heven em i olsem wanpela umben ol i tromoi i go daun long raunwara, na i kisim ol kain kain pis.

ReferenceBlocks.text: When it was filled, they drew up on the beach. They sat down, and gathered the good into containers, but the bad they threw away.

block.text: Umben i pulap, orait ol i pulim i kam sua. Na ol i sindaun na bungim ol gutpela gutpela pis long sampela dis. Tasol ol pis nogut ol i tromoi.

ReferenceBlocks.text: So will it be in the end of the world. The angels will come forth, and separate the wicked from among the righteous.

block.text: Long las de bilong dispela graun bai i olsem tasol. Ol ensel bai i kam na kisim ol man nogut i stap namel long ol stretpela man.

ReferenceBlocks.text: They will cast them into the furnace of fire. There will be the weeping and the gnashing of teeth.”

block.text: Na ol bai i tromoi ol i go long bikpela paia. Long dispela paia ol bai i krai nogut na skrapim tit bilong ol."

ReferenceBlocks.text: Jesus said to them,

block.text: Na Jisas i askim ol disaipel olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Have you understood all these things?”

block.text: "Ating yupela i save as bilong dispela olgeta tok?"

ReferenceBlocks.text: They answered him,

block.text: Na ol i tokim em,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Yes, Lord.”

block.text: "Yes."

ReferenceBlocks.text: He said to them,

block.text: Orait em i tokim ol olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Therefore every scribe who has been made a disciple in the Kingdom of Heaven is like a man who is a householder, who brings out of his treasure new and old things.”

block.text: "Olsem na olgeta saveman bilong lo ol i save pinis long as bilong tok bilong kingdom bilong heven, ol i olsem papa bilong wanpela bikpela haus. Em i go insait long wanpela rum olkain gutpela samting bilong en i pulap i stap long en, na em i kisim ol nupela samting na ol olpela samting wantaim, na bringim i kam ausait."

ReferenceBlocks.text: It happened that when Jesus had finished these parables, he departed from there.

block.text: Jisas i autim pinis ol dispela tok piksa, orait em i lusim dispela ples

ReferenceBlocks.text: Coming into his own country, he taught them in their synagogue, so that they were astonished, and said,

block.text: na em i go long as ples bilong en. Na em i go long haus lotu bilong ol na i givim tok bilong God long ol manmeri. Ol i harim tok bilong en na ol i kirap nogut na i tok,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Where did this man get this wisdom, and these mighty works?

block.text: "Dispela man em i kisim dispela save we? Na olsem wanem em inap wokim ol mirakel?

ReferenceBlocks.text: Isn’t this the carpenter’s son? Isn’t his mother called Mary, and his brothers, James, Joses, Simon, and Judas?

block.text: Yumi save, dispela man em i pikinini bilong wanpela kamda, na Maria em i mama bilong en. Na Jems na Josep na Saimon na Judas, ol i brata bilong en.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Aren’t all of his sisters with us? Where then did this man get all of these things?”

block.text: Na olgeta susa bilong en, ol i stap wantaim yumi. Olsem wanem na em inap mekim ol dispela samting?"

ReferenceBlocks.text: They were offended by him. But Jesus said to them,

block.text: Ol i tok olsem na ol i bel nogut long em. Tasol Jisas i tokim ol olsem

ReferenceBlocks.text: “A prophet is not without honor, except in his own country, and in his own house.”

block.text: "Profet i gat nem long olgeta ples. Tasol long as ples bilong en na long haus bilong en stret em i no gat nem."

ReferenceBlocks.text: He didn’t do many mighty works there because of their unbelief.

block.text: Na em i no wokim planti mirakel long dispela ples, long wanem, ol i no bilip long em.

ReferenceBlocks.text: MATTHEW 14
At that time, Herod the tetrarch heard the report concerning Jesus,
and said to his servants,

block.text: Long dispela taim namba wan gavman Herot i harim stori bilong ol samting Jisas i mekim,
na em i tokim ol wokman bilong en olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “This is John the Baptizer. He is risen from the dead. That is why these powers work in him.”

block.text: "Dispela man em Jon Bilong Baptais tasol. Em i kirap bek long matmat. Olsem na em i gat strong bilong wokim ol dispela mirakel."

ReferenceBlocks.text: For Herod had captured John, bound him, and put him in prison because of Herodias, his brother Philip’s wife.
For John said to him,

block.text: Bipo Herot i bin maritim Herodias, em meri bilong Filip, brata bilong Herot.
Na Jon i bin tokim Herot olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “It is not lawful for you to have her.”

block.text: "Yu kisim dispela meri, em i no stret."

ReferenceBlocks.text: Herod wanted to kill John but he was afraid of the people because they considered John to be a prophet.

block.text: Olsem na Herot i bin holimpas Jon na pasim em long sen na putim em long kalabus.
Na Herot i laik kilim Jon i dai, tasol em i pret long ol manmeri, long wanem, ol i ting Jon em i profet.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But when Herod’s birthday came, the daughter of Herodias danced among them and pleased Herod.
Then he promised her with an oath:

block.text: Wanpela de sampela man i kam kaikai wantaim Herot, bilong tingim de mama i karim em. Na long dispela taim pikinini meri bilong Herodias i kam danis namel long ol. Na Herot i laikim tumas danis bilong en.
Olsem na Herot i mekim promis long em olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “I will give you whatever you ask for!”

block.text: "Tru antap, wanem samting yu askim long mi, em bai mi givim yu."

ReferenceBlocks.text: She, being prompted by her mother, said,

block.text: Orait Herodias, mama bilong dispela meri, em i givim tingting long em, na meri i tokim Herot olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Give me here on a platter the head of John the Baptizer.”

block.text: "Mi laik bai yu putim het bilong Jon Bilong Baptais long wanpela plet, na karim i kam givim long mi."

ReferenceBlocks.text: The king was grieved, but for the sake of his oaths, and of those who sat at the table with him, he commanded that her request be granted.

block.text: King i harim dispela tok, na bel bilong en i hevi. Tasol em i ting long strongpela promis em i bin mekim, na em i no laik kisim sem long ai bilong ol man i sindaun kaikai wantaim em. Olsem na em i tokim ol soldia long mekim olsem meri i bin tok.

ReferenceBlocks.text: He sent and beheaded John in the prison.

block.text: Em i salim wanpela man i go long haus kalabus bilong tokim ol soldia long katim nek bilong Jon.

ReferenceBlocks.text: His head was brought on a platter, and given to the young lady: and she brought it to her mother.

block.text: Na ol i bringim het bilong en long wanpela plet, na ol i givim long dispela yangpela meri. Na em i bringim i go long mama bilong en.

ReferenceBlocks.text: His disciples came, and took the body, and buried it; and they went and told Jesus.

block.text: Na ol disaipel bilong Jon i kam kisim bodi bilong en na karim i go planim. Ol i planim pinis, na ol i go tokim Jisas.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Now when Jesus heard this, he withdrew from there in a boat, to a deserted place apart. When the multitudes heard it, they followed him on foot from the cities.

block.text: Jisas i harim tok long ol i bin kilim Jon i dai, na em i lusim dispela ples na i kisim bot i go long wanpela hap i no gat man. Em wantaim ol disaipel tasol i go. Tasol ol planti lain manmeri i harim tok long Jisas i bin i go, na ol i lusim ol taun, na ol i wokabaut i go painim em.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Jesus went out, and he saw a great multitude. He had compassion on them, and healed their sick.

block.text: Olsem na taim Jisas i go sua em i lukim bikpela lain manmeri i stap. Na em i sori long ol, na i mekim orait ol sikman bilong ol.

ReferenceBlocks.text: When evening had come, his disciples came to him, saying,

block.text: Long apinun ol disaipel i kam long Jisas na tokim em olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “This place is deserted, and the hour is already late. Send the multitudes away, that they may go into the villages, and buy themselves food.”

block.text: "Dispela hap i no gat man, na klostu san i laik i go daun. Mobeta yu salim ol manmeri i go. Ol i ken i go nabaut long ol ples na baim kaikai."

ReferenceBlocks.text: But Jesus said to them,

block.text: Tasol Jisas i tokim ol disaipel olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “They don’t need to go away. You give them something to eat.”

block.text: "Bilong wanem ol i mas i go? Yupela yet givim kaikai long ol."

ReferenceBlocks.text: They told him,

block.text: Na ol i tokim em,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “We only have here five loaves and two fish.”

block.text: "Mipela i no gat planti kaikai i stap hia. I gat 5 -pela bret na tupela pis tasol i stap."

ReferenceBlocks.text: He said,

block.text: Na em i tok,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Bring them here to me.”

block.text: "Kisim dispela bret na pis i kam long mi."

ReferenceBlocks.text: He commanded the multitudes to sit down on the grass; and he took the five loaves and the two fish, and looking up to heaven, he blessed, broke and gave the loaves to the disciples, and the disciples gave to the multitudes.

block.text: Na Jisas i tokim ol manmeri long ol i mas sindaun long gras. Na em i kisim dispela 5 -pela bret wantaim tupela pis, na em i lukluk i go long heven, na i givim tenkyu long God. Na em i brukim ol bret na i givim long ol disaipel. Na ol disaipel i givim long ol manmeri,

ReferenceBlocks.text: They all ate, and were filled. They took up twelve baskets full of that which remained left over from the broken pieces.

block.text: na olgeta i kaikai na ol i pulap. Na olgeta hap kaikai i stap yet, em ol i bungim na pulapim 12 -pela basket.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Those who ate were about five thousand men, besides women and children.

block.text: Ol man i kaikai, ol inap olsem 5,000 man. Ol i no kaunim ol meri na pikinini.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Immediately Jesus made the disciples get into the boat, and to go ahead of him to the other side, while he sent the multitudes away.

block.text: Orait Jisas i tokim ol disaipel long ol i mas kalap long bot na i go paslain long em long hapsait bilong raunwara. Na em yet i laik i stap na salim ol manmeri i go pastaim.

ReferenceBlocks.text: After he had sent the multitudes away, he went up into the mountain by himself to pray. When evening had come, he was there alone.

block.text: Em i salim ol manmeri i go pinis, orait em wanpela i go antap long maunten, bilong em i ken beten. Na long taim san i go daun, em wanpela tasol i stap long maunten.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But the boat was now in the middle of the sea, distressed by the waves, for the wind was contrary.

block.text: Bot i go longwe pinis, na win i kam long poret, na si i sakim bot.

ReferenceBlocks.text: In the fourth watch of the night, Jesus came to them, walking on the sea.

block.text: Na klostu tulait Jisas i wokabaut antap long raunwara na i kamap long ol disaipel.

ReferenceBlocks.text: When the disciples saw him walking on the sea, they were troubled, saying,

block.text: Ol i lukim em i wokabaut antap long raunwara, na ol i pret moa yet na i guria. Ol i tok,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “It’s a ghost!”

block.text: "Em wanpela masalai."

ReferenceBlocks.text: and they cried in fear.
But immediately Jesus spoke to them, saying

block.text: Tasol kwiktaim Jisas i tokim ol olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Cheer up! It is I! Don’t be afraid.”

block.text: "Yupela stap strong. Em mi tasol. Yupela i no ken pret."

ReferenceBlocks.text: Peter answered him and said,

block.text: Na Pita i bekim tok bilong em olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Lord, if it is you, command me to come to you on the waters.”

block.text: "Bikpela, sapos em yu tasol, orait yu tokim mi na mi ken wokabaut antap long wara na mi kam long yu."

ReferenceBlocks.text: He said,

block.text: Na Jisas i tok,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Come!”

block.text: "Yu kam."

ReferenceBlocks.text: Peter stepped down from the boat, and walked on the waters to come to Jesus.

block.text: Orait na Pita i lusim bot na i wokabaut antap long wara na i go long Jisas.

ReferenceBlocks.text: But when he saw that the wind was strong, he was afraid, and beginning to sink, he cried out, saying,

block.text: Tasol em i lukim win i strong tumas na em i pret, na em i go daun liklik insait long wara. Olsem na em i singaut olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “Lord, save me!”

block.text: "Bikpela, helpim mi."

ReferenceBlocks.text: Immediately Jesus stretched out his hand, took hold of him, and said to him,

block.text: Kwiktaim Jisas i putim han na i holim Pita. Na Jisas i tokim em olsem,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “You of little faith, why did you doubt?”

block.text: "Yu gat liklik bilip tasol. Bilong wanem yu gat tupela tingting?"

ReferenceBlocks.text: When they got up into the boat, the wind ceased.

block.text: Na tupela i kalap long bot, na win i dai.

ReferenceBlocks.text: Those who were in the boat came and worshiped him, saying,

block.text: Na ol man i stap long bot, ol i lotu long Jisas na ol i tok,

ReferenceBlocks.text: “You are truly the Son of God!”

block.text: "Tru tumas, yu Pikinini Bilong God."

ReferenceBlocks.text: When they had crossed over, they came to the land of Gennesaret.

block.text: Jisas wantaim ol disaipel i brukim raunwara pinis na ol i go sua long hap bilong Genesaret.
